表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of line item in statement of financial position that includes hedging instrument
標準ラベル（英）: Description of line item in statement of financial position that includes hedging instrument
標準ラベル（日）: 財政状態計算書におけるヘッジ手段を含んだ表示科目の記述
定義: The description of the line item in the statement of financial position that includes the hedging instrument. [Refer: Hedging instruments [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Gain (loss) on change in fair value of hedging instrument used as basis for recognising hedge ineffectiveness
標準ラベル（英）: Gain (loss) on change in fair value of hedging instrument used as basis for recognising hedge ineffectiveness
標準ラベル（日）: ヘッジ非有効部分を認識する基礎として使用したヘッジ手段の公正価値の変動に係る利得（損失）
定義: The gain (loss) on the change in fair value of the hedging instrument used as a basis for recognising hedge ineffectiveness. Hedge ineffectiveness is the extent to which the changes in the fair value or the cash flows of the hedging instrument are greater or less than those on the hedged item.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Nominal amount of hedging instrument
標準ラベル（英）: Nominal amount of hedging instrument
標準ラベル（日）: ヘッジ手段の名目金額
定義: The nominal amount of a hedging instrument. [Refer: Hedging instruments [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of detailed information about hedged items [text block]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of detailed information about hedged items [text block]
標準ラベル（日）: ヘッジ対象に関する詳細情報の開示 [テキストブロック]
定義: The disclosure of detailed information about hedged items. [Refer: Hedged items [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of detailed information about hedged items [abstract]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of detailed information about hedged items [abstract]
標準ラベル（日）: ヘッジ対象に関する詳細情報の開示 [タイトル項目]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of detailed information about hedged items [table]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of detailed information about hedged items [table]
標準ラベル（日）: ヘッジ対象に関する詳細情報の開示 [表]
定義: Schedule disclosing information related to details of hedged items.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Types of risks [axis]
標準ラベル（英）: Types of risks [axis]
標準ラベル（日）: リスクの種類 [軸]
定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Risks [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Risks [member]
標準ラベル（日）: リスク [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for all types of risks. It also represents the standard value for the 'Types of risks' axis if no other member is used.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Credit risk [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Credit risk [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 信用リスク [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for the risk that one party to a financial instrument will cause a financial loss for the other party by failing to discharge an obligation. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Liquidity risk [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Liquidity risk [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 流動性リスク [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for the risk that an entity will encounter difficulty in meeting obligations associated with financial liabilities that are settled by delivering cash or another financial asset. [Refer: Financial assets; Financial liabilities]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Market risk [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Market risk [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 市場リスク [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for the risk that the fair value or future cash flows of a financial instrument will fluctuate because of changes in market prices. Market risk comprises three types of risk: currency risk, interest rate risk and other price risk. [Refer: Currency risk [member]; Interest rate risk [member]; Other price risk [member]; Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Currency risk [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Currency risk [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 為替リスク [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a type of market risk representing the risk that the fair value or future cash flows of a financial instrument will fluctuate because of changes in foreign exchange rates. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Interest rate risk [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Interest rate risk [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 金利リスク [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for the type of risk that the fair value or future cash flows of a financial instrument will fluctuate because of changes in market interest rates. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Other price risk [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Other price risk [member]
標準ラベル（日）: その他の価格リスク [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a type of market risk representing the risk that the fair value or future cash flows of a financial instrument will fluctuate because of changes in market prices (other than those arising from interest rate risk or currency risk), whether those changes are caused by factors specific to the individual financial instrument or its issuer, or by factors affecting all similar financial instruments traded in the market. [Refer: Currency risk [member]; Interest rate risk [member]; Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Equity price risk [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Equity price risk [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 株価リスク [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a component of other price risk that represents the type of risk that the fair value or future cash flows of a financial instrument will fluctuate because of changes in equity prices. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Commodity price risk [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Commodity price risk [member]
標準ラベル（日）: コモディティ価格リスク [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a component of other price risk that represents the type of risk that the fair value or future cash flows of a financial instrument will fluctuate because of changes in commodity prices. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Prepayment risk [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Prepayment risk [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 期限前償還リスク [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for the type of risk that one party to a financial asset will incur a financial loss because the other party repays earlier or later than expected. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Residual value risk [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Residual value risk [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 残存価値リスク [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a component of other price risk that represents the type of risk that the fair value or future cash flows of a financial instrument will fluctuate because of changes in residual values. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Risk diversification effect [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Risk diversification effect [member]
標準ラベル（日）: リスク分散効果 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for the effect of the diversification of risks arising from financial instruments. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Types of hedges [axis]
標準ラベル（英）: Types of hedges [axis]
標準ラベル（日）: ヘッジの種類 [軸]
定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Hedges [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Hedges [member]
標準ラベル（日）: ヘッジ [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for all types of hedges. It also represents the standard value for the 'Types of hedges' axis if no other member is used.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Fair value hedges [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Fair value hedges [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 公正価値ヘッジ [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for hedges of the exposure to changes in fair value of a recognised asset or liability or an unrecognised firm commitment, or an identified portion of such an asset, liability or firm commitment, that is attributable to a particular risk and could affect profit or loss. [Refer: Hedges [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Cash flow hedges [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Cash flow hedges [member]
標準ラベル（日）: キャッシュ・フロー・ヘッジ [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for hedges of the exposure to variability in cash flows that (a) are attributable to a particular risk associated with a recognised asset or liability (such as all or some future interest payments on variable rate debt) or a highly probable forecast transaction; and (b) could affect profit or loss. [Refer: Hedges [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Hedges of net investment in foreign operations [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Hedges of net investment in foreign operations [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 在外営業活動体に対する純投資のヘッジ [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for hedges of the entity's monetary items that are receivable from or payable to a foreign operation, for which settlement is neither planned nor likely to occur in the foreseeable future. A foreign operation is an entity that is a subsidiary, associate, joint venture or branch of a reporting entity, the activities of which are based or conducted in a country or currency other than those of the reporting entity.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Hedged items [axis]
標準ラベル（英）: Hedged items [axis]
標準ラベル（日）: ヘッジ対象 [軸]
定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Hedged items [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Hedged items [member]
標準ラベル（日）: ヘッジ対象 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for hedged items. A hedged item can be a recognised asset or liability, an unrecognised firm commitment, a forecast transaction or a net investment in a foreign operation. The hedged item can be: (a) a single item; or (b) a group of items (subject to paragraphs 6.6.1–6.6.6 and B6.6.1–B6.6.16 of IFRS 9). A hedged item can also be a component of such an item or group of items (see paragraphs 6.3.7 and B6.3.7–B6.3.25 of IFRS 9). This member also represents the standard value for the 'Hedged items' axis if no other member is used.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of detailed information about hedged items [line items]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of detailed information about hedged items [line items]
標準ラベル（日）: ヘッジ対象に関する詳細情報の開示 [表示項目]
定義: Line items represent concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes of the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Hedged item, assets
標準ラベル（英）: Hedged item, assets
標準ラベル（日）: ヘッジ対象：資産
定義: The amount of a hedged item, recognised as an asset. [Refer: Hedged items [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Hedged item, liabilities
標準ラベル（英）: Hedged item, liabilities
標準ラベル（日）: ヘッジ対象：負債
定義: The amount of a hedged item, recognised as a liability. [Refer: Hedged items [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Accumulated fair value hedge adjustment on hedged item included in carrying amount, assets
標準ラベル（英）: Accumulated fair value hedge adjustment on hedged item included in carrying amount, assets
標準ラベル（日）: 帳簿価額に含めたヘッジ対象に係る公正価値ヘッジ調整累計額：資産
定義: The accumulated amount of fair value hedge adjustment on a hedged item that is included in the carrying amount of the hedged item, recognised in the statement of financial position as an asset. [Refer: Hedged items [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Accumulated fair value hedge adjustment on hedged item included in carrying amount, liabilities
標準ラベル（英）: Accumulated fair value hedge adjustment on hedged item included in carrying amount, liabilities
標準ラベル（日）: 帳簿価額に含めたヘッジ対象に係る公正価値ヘッジ調整累計額：負債
定義: The accumulated amount of fair value hedge adjustment on a hedged item that is included in the carrying amount of the hedged item, recognised in the statement of financial position as a liability. [Refer: Hedged items [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of line item in statement of financial position that includes hedged item
標準ラベル（英）: Description of line item in statement of financial position that includes hedged item
標準ラベル（日）: 財政状態計算書におけるヘッジ対象を含んだ表示科目の記述
定義: The description of the line item in the statement of financial position that includes the hedged item. [Refer: Hedged items [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Gain (loss) on change in fair value of hedged item used as basis for recognising hedge ineffectiveness
標準ラベル（英）: Gain (loss) on change in fair value of hedged item used as basis for recognising hedge ineffectiveness
標準ラベル（日）: ヘッジ非有効部分を認識する基礎として使用したヘッジ対象の公正価値の変動に係る利得（損失）
定義: The gain (loss) on the change in fair value of the hedged item used as a basis for recognising hedge ineffectiveness. Hedge ineffectiveness is the extent to which the changes in the fair value or the cash flows of the hedging instrument are greater or less than those on the hedged item.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Accumulated fair value hedge adjustment remaining in statement of financial position for hedged item that ceased to be adjusted for hedging gains and losses, assets
標準ラベル（英）: Accumulated fair value hedge adjustment remaining in statement of financial position for hedged item that ceased to be adjusted for hedging gains and losses, assets
標準ラベル（日）: ヘッジ損益に係る調整を中止したヘッジ対象について財政状態計算書に残っている公正価値ヘッジ調整累計額：資産
定義: The accumulated amount of fair value hedge adjustment remaining in the statement of financial position for a hedged item that is a financial asset measured at amortised cost and has ceased to be adjusted for hedging gains and losses. [Refer: Financial assets at amortised cost; Hedged items [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Accumulated fair value hedge adjustment remaining in statement of financial position for hedged item that ceased to be adjusted for hedging gains and losses, liabilities
標準ラベル（英）: Accumulated fair value hedge adjustment remaining in statement of financial position for hedged item that ceased to be adjusted for hedging gains and losses, liabilities
標準ラベル（日）: ヘッジ損益に係る調整を中止したヘッジ対象について財政状態計算書に残っている公正価値ヘッジ調整累計額：負債
定義: The accumulated amount of fair value hedge adjustment remaining in the statement of financial position for a hedged item that is a financial liability measured at amortised cost and has ceased to be adjusted for hedging gains and losses. [Refer: Financial liabilities at amortised cost; Hedged items [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Reserve of cash flow hedges, continuing hedges
標準ラベル（英）: Reserve of cash flow hedges, continuing hedges
標準ラベル（日）: キャッシュ・フロー・ヘッジに係る剰余金：継続中のヘッジ
定義: A component of equity representing the reserve of cash flow hedges in relation to continuing hedges. [Refer: Reserve of cash flow hedges]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Reserve of exchange differences on translation, continuing hedges
標準ラベル（英）: Reserve of exchange differences on translation, continuing hedges
標準ラベル（日）: 為替換算差額に係る剰余金：継続中のヘッジ
定義: A component of equity representing the reserve of exchange differences on translation in relation to continuing hedges. [Refer: Reserve of exchange differences on translation]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Reserve of cash flow hedges, hedging relationships for which hedge accounting is no longer applied
標準ラベル（英）: Reserve of cash flow hedges, hedging relationships for which hedge accounting is no longer applied
標準ラベル（日）: キャッシュ・フロー・ヘッジに係る剰余金：ヘッジ会計が適用されなくなったヘッジ関係
定義: A component of equity representing the reserve of cash flow hedges in relation to hedging relationships for which hedge accounting is no longer applied. [Refer: Reserve of cash flow hedges]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Reserve of exchange differences on translation, hedging relationships for which hedge accounting is no longer applied
標準ラベル（英）: Reserve of exchange differences on translation, hedging relationships for which hedge accounting is no longer applied
標準ラベル（日）: 為替換算差額に係る剰余金：ヘッジ会計が適用されなくなったヘッジ関係
定義: A component of equity representing the reserve of exchange differences on translation in relation to hedging relationships for which hedge accounting is no longer applied. [Refer: Reserve of exchange differences on translation]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of information about amounts that affected statement of comprehensive income as result of hedge accounting [text block]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of information about amounts that affected statement of comprehensive income as result of hedge accounting [text block]
標準ラベル（日）: ヘッジ会計の結果として包括利益計算書に影響を与えた金額に関する情報の開示 [テキストブロック]
定義: The disclosure of information about amounts that affected the statement of comprehensive income as a result of hedge accounting.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of information about amounts that affected statement of comprehensive income as result of hedge accounting [abstract]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of information about amounts that affected statement of comprehensive income as result of hedge accounting [abstract]
標準ラベル（日）: ヘッジ会計の結果として包括利益計算書に影響を与えた金額に関する情報の開示 [タイトル項目]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of information about amounts that affected statement of comprehensive income as result of hedge accounting [table]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of information about amounts that affected statement of comprehensive income as result of hedge accounting [table]
標準ラベル（日）: ヘッジ会計の結果として包括利益計算書に影響を与えた金額に関する情報の開示 [表]
定義: Schedule disclosing information related to amounts that affected the statement of comprehensive income as a result of hedge accounting.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Cash flow hedges [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Cash flow hedges [member]
標準ラベル（日）: キャッシュ・フロー・ヘッジ [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for hedges of the exposure to variability in cash flows that (a) are attributable to a particular risk associated with a recognised asset or liability (such as all or some future interest payments on variable rate debt) or a highly probable forecast transaction; and (b) could affect profit or loss. [Refer: Hedges [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Hedges of net investment in foreign operations [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Hedges of net investment in foreign operations [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 在外営業活動体に対する純投資のヘッジ [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for hedges of the entity's monetary items that are receivable from or payable to a foreign operation, for which settlement is neither planned nor likely to occur in the foreseeable future. A foreign operation is an entity that is a subsidiary, associate, joint venture or branch of a reporting entity, the activities of which are based or conducted in a country or currency other than those of the reporting entity.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of information about amounts that affected statement of comprehensive income as result of hedge accounting [line items]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of information about amounts that affected statement of comprehensive income as result of hedge accounting [line items]
標準ラベル（日）: ヘッジ会計の結果として包括利益計算書に影響を与えた金額に関する情報の開示 [表示項目]
定義: Line items represent concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes of the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Gain (loss) on hedge ineffectiveness [abstract]
標準ラベル（英）: Gain (loss) on hedge ineffectiveness [abstract]
標準ラベル（日）: ヘッジ非有効部分に係る利得（損失） [タイトル項目]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Gain (loss) on hedge ineffectiveness recognised in profit or loss
標準ラベル（英）: Gain (loss) on hedge ineffectiveness recognised in profit or loss
標準ラベル（日）: 純損益に認識したヘッジ非有効部分に係る利得（損失）
定義: The gain (loss) recognised in profit or loss on hedge ineffectiveness. [Refer: Gain (loss) on hedge ineffectiveness]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Gain (loss) on hedge ineffectiveness recognised in other comprehensive income
標準ラベル（英）: Gain (loss) on hedge ineffectiveness recognised in other comprehensive income
標準ラベル（日）: その他の包括利益に認識したヘッジ非有効部分に係る利得（損失）
定義: The gain (loss) recognised in other comprehensive income on hedge ineffectiveness. [Refer: Gain (loss) on hedge ineffectiveness]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Total gain (loss) on hedge ineffectiveness
標準ラベル（英）: Gain (loss) on hedge ineffectiveness
標準ラベル（日）: ヘッジ非有効部分に係る利得（損失）
定義: The gain (loss) on hedge ineffectiveness. Hedge ineffectiveness is the extent to which the changes in the fair value or the cash flows of the hedging instrument are greater or less than those on the hedged item.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of line item in statement of comprehensive income that includes recognised hedge ineffectiveness
標準ラベル（英）: Description of line item in statement of comprehensive income that includes recognised hedge ineffectiveness
標準ラベル（日）: 包括利益計算書における認識されたヘッジ非有効部分を含んだ表示科目の記述
定義: The description of the line item in the statement of comprehensive income that includes the recognised hedge ineffectiveness. [Refer: Gain (loss) on hedge ineffectiveness]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Gains (losses) on cash flow hedges, net of tax
標準ラベル（英）: Gains (losses) on cash flow hedges, net of tax
標準ラベル（日）: キャッシュ・フロー・ヘッジに係る利得（損失）（税引後）
定義: The gains (losses) recognised in other comprehensive income on cash flow hedges, net of tax. [Refer: Cash flow hedges [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Gains (losses) on hedges of net investments in foreign operations, net of tax
標準ラベル（英）: Gains (losses) on hedges of net investments in foreign operations, net of tax
標準ラベル（日）: 在外営業活動体に対する純投資のヘッジに係る利得（損失）：税引後
定義: The gains (losses) recognised in other comprehensive income on hedges of net investments in foreign operations, net of tax. [Refer: Other comprehensive income]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Reclassification adjustments on cash flow hedges, net of tax
標準ラベル（英）: Reclassification adjustments on cash flow hedges, net of tax
標準ラベル（日）: キャッシュ・フロー・ヘッジに係る組替調整額（税引後）
定義: The amount of reclassification adjustments related to cash flow hedges, net of tax. Reclassification adjustments are amounts reclassified to profit (loss) in the current period that were recognised in other comprehensive income in the current or previous periods. [Refer: Cash flow hedges [member]; Other comprehensive income]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Reclassification adjustments on cash flow hedges for which hedged future cash flows are no longer expected to occur, net of tax
標準ラベル（英）: Reclassification adjustments on cash flow hedges for which hedged future cash flows are no longer expected to occur, net of tax

定義: The amount of reclassification adjustments on cash flow hedges for which the hedged future cash flows are no longer expected to occur, net of tax. [Refer: Reclassification adjustments on cash flow hedges, net of tax]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Reclassification adjustments on cash flow hedges for which hedged item affected profit or loss, net of tax
標準ラベル（英）: Reclassification adjustments on cash flow hedges for which hedged item affected profit or loss, net of tax
標準ラベル（日）: ヘッジ対象が純損益に影響を与えたキャッシュ・フロー・ヘッジに係る組替調整額（税引後）
定義: The amount of reclassification adjustments on cash flow hedges for which the hedged item affected profit or loss, net of tax. [Refer: Reclassification adjustments on cash flow hedges, net of tax]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Reclassification adjustments on hedges of net investments in foreign operations, net of tax
標準ラベル（英）: Reclassification adjustments on hedges of net investments in foreign operations, net of tax
標準ラベル（日）: 在外営業活動体に対する純投資のヘッジに係る組替調整額（税引後）
定義: The amount of reclassification adjustments related to hedges of net investments in foreign operations, net of tax. Reclassification adjustments are amounts reclassified to profit (loss) in the current period that were recognised in other comprehensive income in the current or previous periods. [Refer: Other comprehensive income]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of line item in statement of comprehensive income that includes reclassification adjustments
標準ラベル（英）: Description of line item in statement of comprehensive income that includes reclassification adjustments
標準ラベル（日）: 包括利益計算書における組替調整額を含んだ表示科目の記述
定義: The description of the line item in the statement of comprehensive income that includes the reclassification adjustments. Reclassification adjustments are amounts reclassified to profit (loss) in the current period that were recognised in other comprehensive income in the current or previous periods.

定義: The hedging gains (losses) for hedge of group of items with offsetting risk positions.

定義: The fair value of a financial instrument, recognised as a liability, on discontinuation of its measurement at fair value through profit or loss, because a credit derivative is used to manage the credit risk of that financial instrument. [Refer: Credit risk [member]; Derivatives [member]; Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of information about possible differences between carrying amount and fair value of contracts described in IFRS 7.29 b and IFRS 7.29 c [text block]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of information about possible differences between carrying amount and fair value of contracts described in IFRS 7.29 b and IFRS 7.29 c [text block]
標準ラベル（日）: IFRS第7号の第29項(b)及び(c)に示した契約の帳簿価額と公正価値との間に生じ得る差異に関する情報の開示 [テキストブロック]
定義: The disclosure of information about the extent of possible differences between the carrying amount and fair value of: (a) investments in equity instruments that do not have a quoted market price in an active market (or derivatives linked to such equity instruments) that are measured at cost because their fair value cannot be measured reliably; and (b) contracts containing a discretionary participation feature if the fair value of that feature cannot be measured reliably.

標準ラベル（英）: Liquidity risk [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 流動性リスク [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for the risk that an entity will encounter difficulty in meeting obligations associated with financial liabilities that are settled by delivering cash or another financial asset. [Refer: Financial assets; Financial liabilities]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Market risk [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Market risk [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 市場リスク [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for the risk that the fair value or future cash flows of a financial instrument will fluctuate because of changes in market prices. Market risk comprises three types of risk: currency risk, interest rate risk and other price risk. [Refer: Currency risk [member]; Interest rate risk [member]; Other price risk [member]; Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Currency risk [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Currency risk [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 為替リスク [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a type of market risk representing the risk that the fair value or future cash flows of a financial instrument will fluctuate because of changes in foreign exchange rates. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Interest rate risk [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Interest rate risk [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 金利リスク [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for the type of risk that the fair value or future cash flows of a financial instrument will fluctuate because of changes in market interest rates. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Other price risk [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Other price risk [member]
標準ラベル（日）: その他の価格リスク [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a type of market risk representing the risk that the fair value or future cash flows of a financial instrument will fluctuate because of changes in market prices (other than those arising from interest rate risk or currency risk), whether those changes are caused by factors specific to the individual financial instrument or its issuer, or by factors affecting all similar financial instruments traded in the market. [Refer: Currency risk [member]; Interest rate risk [member]; Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Equity price risk [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Equity price risk [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 株価リスク [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a component of other price risk that represents the type of risk that the fair value or future cash flows of a financial instrument will fluctuate because of changes in equity prices. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Commodity price risk [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Commodity price risk [member]
標準ラベル（日）: コモディティ価格リスク [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a component of other price risk that represents the type of risk that the fair value or future cash flows of a financial instrument will fluctuate because of changes in commodity prices. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Prepayment risk [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Prepayment risk [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 期限前償還リスク [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for the type of risk that one party to a financial asset will incur a financial loss because the other party repays earlier or later than expected. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Residual value risk [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Residual value risk [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 残存価値リスク [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a component of other price risk that represents the type of risk that the fair value or future cash flows of a financial instrument will fluctuate because of changes in residual values. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Risk diversification effect [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Risk diversification effect [member]
標準ラベル（日）: リスク分散効果 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for the effect of the diversification of risks arising from financial instruments. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of nature and extent of risks arising from financial instruments [line items]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of nature and extent of risks arising from financial instruments [line items]
標準ラベル（日）: 金融商品から生じるリスクの内容及び程度の開示 [表示項目]
定義: Line items represent concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes of the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of exposure to risk
標準ラベル（英）: Description of exposure to risk
標準ラベル（日）: リスクに対するエクスポージャーの記述
定義: The description of exposures to risks arising from financial instruments. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of objectives, policies and processes for managing risk
標準ラベル（英）: Description of objectives, policies and processes for managing risk
標準ラベル（日）: リスク管理の目的、方針及び手続の記述
定義: The description of objectives, policies and processes for managing the risks that arise from financial instruments. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Methods used to measure risk
標準ラベル（英）: Methods used to measure risk
標準ラベル（日）: リスクを測定するために用いている方法
定義: The description of the methods used to measure risks arising from financial instruments. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of changes in exposure to risk
標準ラベル（英）: Description of changes in exposure to risk
標準ラベル（日）: リスクに対するエクスポージャーの変動の記述
定義: The description of changes in the exposure to risks arising from financial instruments. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of changes in objectives, policies and processes for managing risk
標準ラベル（英）: Description of changes in objectives, policies and processes for managing risk
標準ラベル（日）: リスク管理の目的、方針及び手続の変更の記述
定義: The description of changes in objectives, policies and processes for managing risks arising from financial instruments. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of changes in methods used to measure risk
標準ラベル（英）: Description of changes in methods used to measure risk
標準ラベル（日）: リスクの測定に用いた方法の変更の記述
定義: The description of changes in methods used to measure risks arising from financial instruments. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Summary quantitative data about entity's exposure to risk [text block]
標準ラベル（英）: Summary quantitative data about entity's exposure to risk [text block]
標準ラベル（日）: リスクに対する企業のエクスポージャーに関する定量的データの要約 [テキストブロック]
定義: The disclosure of summary quantitative data about the entity's exposure to risks arising from financial instruments. This disclosure shall be based on the information provided internally to key management personnel of the entity, for example, the entity’s board of directors or chief executive officer. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]; Key management personnel of entity or parent [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of concentrations of risk
標準ラベル（英）: Description of concentrations of risk
標準ラベル（日）: リスクの集中の記述
定義: The description of concentrations of risks arising from financial instruments. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of how management determines concentrations
標準ラベル（英）: Description of how management determines concentrations
標準ラベル（日）: 経営者が集中を判断する方法の記述
定義: The description of how management determines concentrations of risks arising from financial instruments. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of shared characteristic for concentration
標準ラベル（英）: Description of shared characteristic for concentration
標準ラベル（日）: リスクの集中の共通した特徴の記述
定義: The description of a shared characteristic for the concentration of risks arising from financial instruments (for example, counterparty, geographical area, currency or market). [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Risk exposure associated with instruments sharing characteristic
標準ラベル（英）: Risk exposure associated with instruments sharing characteristic
標準ラベル（日）: 特徴を共有する金融商品に関連したリスク・エクスポージャー
定義: The amount of risk exposure associated with financial instruments with a shared characteristic that identifies a concentration of risks. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Additional information about entity exposure to risk
標準ラベル（英）: Additional information about entity exposure to risk
標準ラベル（日）: リスクに対する企業のエクスポージャーに関する追加的な情報
定義: Additional information about the entity's exposure to risk when the quantitative data disclosed are unrepresentative.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Sensitivity analysis for types of market risk [text block]
標準ラベル（英）: Sensitivity analysis for types of market risk [text block]
標準ラベル（日）: 市場リスクの種類ごとの感応度分析 [テキストブロック]
定義: The disclosure of the sensitivity analysis for types of market risk to which the entity is exposed, showing how profit or loss and equity would have been affected by changes in the relevant risk variable that were reasonably possible at that date. [Refer: Market risk [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of credit risk [text block]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of credit risk [text block]
標準ラベル（日）: 信用リスクの開示 [テキストブロック]
定義: The disclosure of credit risk. [Refer: Credit risk [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of cross-reference to disclosures about credit risk presented outside financial statements
標準ラベル（英）: Description of cross-reference to disclosures about credit risk presented outside financial statements
標準ラベル（日）: 財務諸表外に表示した信用リスクに関する開示への参照の記述
定義: The description of cross-reference to disclosures about credit risk presented outside the financial statements.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Explanation of credit risk management practices and how they relate to recognition and measurement of expected credit losses [text block]
標準ラベル（英）: Explanation of credit risk management practices and how they relate to recognition and measurement of expected credit losses [text block]
標準ラベル（日）: リスク管理実務及びそれらが予想信用損失の認識及び測定にどのように関連するのかの説明
定義: The explanation of the credit risk management practices and how they relate to the recognition and measurement of expected credit losses.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Information on how entity determined whether credit risk of financial instruments has increased significantly since initial recognition
標準ラベル（英）: Information on how entity determined whether credit risk of financial instruments has increased significantly since initial recognition
標準ラベル（日）: 金融商品の信用リスクが当初認識以降に著しく増大したかどうかを企業がどのように判定したのかに関する情報
定義: Information on how an entity determined whether the credit risk of financial instruments has increased significantly since initial recognition, including if and how: (a) financial instruments are considered to have low credit risk; and (b) the presumption that there have been significant increases in credit risk since initial recognition when financial assets are more than 30 days past due, has been rebutted. [Refer: Credit risk [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Information about entity's definitions of default
標準ラベル（英）: Information about entity's definitions of default
標準ラベル（日）: 債務不履行についての企業の定義に関する情報
定義: Information about an entity's definitions of default, including the reasons for selecting those definitions.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Information on how instruments were grouped if expected credit losses were measured on collective basis
標準ラベル（英）: Information on how instruments were grouped if expected credit losses were measured on collective basis
標準ラベル（日）: 予想信用損失を集合的に測定していた場合に金融商品をどのようにグループ分けしたのかに関する情報
定義: Information on how the instruments were grouped if expected credit losses were measured on a collective basis.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Information on how entity determined that financial assets are credit-impaired financial assets
標準ラベル（英）: Information on how entity determined that financial assets are credit-impaired financial assets
標準ラベル（日）: 金融資産が信用減損金融資産であることを企業がどのように判定したのかに関する情報
定義: Information on how an entity determined that financial assets are credit-impaired financial assets.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Information on entity's write-off policy
標準ラベル（英）: Information on entity's write-off policy
標準ラベル（日）: 企業の直接償却の方針に関する情報
定義: Information on an entity's write-off policy, including the indicators that there is no reasonable expectation of recovery and information about the policy for financial assets that are written-off but are still subject to enforcement activity.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Information on how requirements for modification of contractual cash flows of financial assets have been applied
標準ラベル（英）: Information on how requirements for modification of contractual cash flows of financial assets have been applied
標準ラベル（日）: 金融資産の契約上のキャッシュ・フローの条件変更についての要求事項をどのように適用したのかに関する情報
定義: Information on how the requirements for the modification of contractual cash flows of financial assets have been applied, including how an entity: (a) determines whether the credit risk on a financial asset that has been modified while the loss allowance was measured at an amount equal to lifetime expected credit losses, has improved to the extent that the loss allowance reverts to being measured at an amount equal to 12-month expected credit losses; and (b) monitors the extent to which the loss allowance on financial assets meeting the criteria in (a) is subsequently remeasured at an amount equal to lifetime expected credit losses.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Explanation of inputs, assumptions and estimation techniques used to apply impairment requirements [text block]
標準ラベル（英）: Explanation of inputs, assumptions and estimation techniques used to apply impairment requirements [text block]
標準ラベル（日）: 減損の要求事項を適用するために用いたインプット、仮定及び見積技法の説明 [テキストブロック]
定義: The explanation of the inputs, assumptions and estimation techniques used to apply the impairment requirements for financial instruments.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of basis of inputs and assumptions and estimation techniques used to measure 12-month and lifetime expected credit losses
標準ラベル（英）: Description of basis of inputs and assumptions and estimation techniques used to measure 12-month and lifetime expected credit losses
標準ラベル（日）: 12か月及び全期間の予想信用損失を測定するために用いたインプット及び仮定の基礎並びに見積技法の記述
定義: The description of the basis of inputs and assumptions and the estimation techniques used to measure the 12-month and lifetime expected credit losses.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of basis of inputs and assumptions and estimation techniques used to determine whether credit risk of financial instruments have increased significantly since initial recognition
標準ラベル（英）: Description of basis of inputs and assumptions and estimation techniques used to determine whether credit risk of financial instruments have increased significantly since initial recognition
標準ラベル（日）: 金融商品の信用リスクが当初認識以降に著しく増大したかどうかを判定するために用いたインプット及び仮定の基礎並びに見積技法の記述
定義: The description of the basis of inputs and assumptions and the estimation techniques used to determine whether the credit risk of financial instruments have increased significantly since initial recognition.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of basis of inputs and assumptions and estimation techniques used to determine whether financial asset is credit-impaired financial asset
標準ラベル（英）: Description of basis of inputs and assumptions and estimation techniques used to determine whether financial asset is credit-impaired financial asset
標準ラベル（日）: 金融資産が信用減損金融資産なのかどうかを判定するために用いたインプット及び仮定の基礎並びに見積技法の記述
定義: The description of the basis of inputs and assumptions and the estimation techniques used to determine whether a financial asset is a credit-impaired financial asset.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of how forward-looking information has been incorporated into determination of expected credit losses
標準ラベル（英）: Description of how forward-looking information has been incorporated into determination of expected credit losses
標準ラベル（日）: 将来予測的な情報をどのように予想信用損失の算定に組み込んだのかの記述
定義: The description of how forward-looking information has been incorporated into the determination of expected credit losses, including the use of macroeconomic information.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of changes in estimation techniques or significant assumptions made when applying impairment requirements and reasons for those changes
標準ラベル（英）: Description of changes in estimation techniques or significant assumptions made when applying impairment requirements and reasons for those changes
標準ラベル（日）: 減損の要求事項を適用する際に行った見積技法又は重要な仮定の変更及び当該変更の理由の記述
定義: The description of changes in the estimation techniques or significant assumptions made when applying impairment requirements and the reasons for those changes.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of reconciliation of changes in loss allowance and explanation of changes in gross carrying amount for financial instruments [text block]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of reconciliation of changes in loss allowance and explanation of changes in gross carrying amount for financial instruments [text block]
標準ラベル（日）: 損失評価引当金の変動の調整表及び金融商品の総額での帳簿価額の変動の説明の開示 [テキストブロック]
定義: The disclosure of the reconciliation of changes in the loss allowance and explanation of changes in the gross carrying amount for financial instruments. Loss allowance is the allowance for expected credit losses on financial assets measured in accordance with paragraph 4.1.2 of IFRS 9, lease receivables and contract assets, the accumulated impairment amount for financial assets measured in accordance with paragraph 4.1.2A of IFRS 9 and the provision for expected credit losses on loan commitments and financial guarantee contracts. [Refer: Gross carrying amount [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of reconciliation of changes in loss allowance and explanation of changes in gross carrying amount for financial instruments [abstract]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of reconciliation of changes in loss allowance and explanation of changes in gross carrying amount for financial instruments [abstract]
標準ラベル（日）: 損失評価引当金の変動の調整表及び金融商品の総額での帳簿価額の変動の説明の開示 [タイトル項目]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of reconciliation of changes in loss allowance and explanation of changes in gross carrying amount for financial instruments [table]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of reconciliation of changes in loss allowance and explanation of changes in gross carrying amount for financial instruments [table]
標準ラベル（日）: 損失評価引当金の変動の調整表及び金融商品の総額での帳簿価額の変動の説明の開示 [表]
定義: Schedule disclosing information related to the reconciliation of changes in the loss allowance and explanation of changes in the gross carrying amount for financial instruments.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Classes of financial instruments [axis]
標準ラベル（英）: Classes of financial instruments [axis]
標準ラベル（日）: 金融商品のクラス [軸]
定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Financial instruments, class [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Financial instruments, class [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 金融商品（クラス） [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for aggregated classes of financial instruments. Financial instruments are contracts that give rise to a financial asset of one entity and a financial liability or equity instrument of another entity. It also represents the standard value for the 'Classes of financial instruments' axis if no other member is used. [Refer: Financial assets; Financial liabilities]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Loan commitments [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Loan commitments [member]
標準ラベル（日）: ローン・コミットメント [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for firm commitments to provide credit under pre-specified terms and conditions.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Financial guarantee contracts [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Financial guarantee contracts [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 金融保証契約 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for contracts that require the issuer to make specified payments to reimburse the holder for a loss it incurs because a specified debtor fails to make payment when due in accordance with the original or modified terms of a debt instrument.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Trade receivables [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Trade receivables [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 売掛金 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for trade receivables. [Refer: Trade receivables]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Contract assets [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Contract assets [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 契約資産 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for contract assets. [Refer: Contract assets]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Lease receivables [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Lease receivables [member]
標準ラベル（日）: リース債権 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for receivables related to leases.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Mortgages [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Mortgages [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 住宅ローン [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a class of financial assets that represents loans to finance the purchase of assets where the asset acts as collateral to secure the loan.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Loans to consumers [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Loans to consumers [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 消費者に対する貸付金 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for loans that are made to individuals for personal use.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Loans to corporate entities [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Loans to corporate entities [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 法人企業に対する貸付金 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for loans made to corporate entities.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Loans to government [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Loans to government [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 政府に対する貸付金 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for loans made to government.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Type of measurement of expected credit losses [axis]
標準ラベル（英）: Type of measurement of expected credit losses [axis]
標準ラベル（日）: 予想信用損失の測定の種類 [軸]
定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Type of measurement of expected credit losses [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Type of measurement of expected credit losses [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 予想信用損失の測定の種類 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for all types of measurement of expected credit losses. Expected credit losses are the weighted average of credit losses with the respective risks of a default occurring as the weights. This member also represents the standard value for the 'Type of measurement of expected credit losses' axis if no other member is used.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: 12-month expected credit losses [member]
標準ラベル（英）: 12-month expected credit losses [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 12か月の予想信用損失 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for the portion of lifetime expected credit losses that represent the expected credit losses that result from default events on a financial instrument that are possible within the 12 months after the reporting date. [Refer: Type of measurement of expected credit losses [member]; Lifetime expected credit losses [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Lifetime expected credit losses [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Lifetime expected credit losses [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 全期間の予想信用損失 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for the expected credit losses that result from all possible default events over the expected life of a financial instrument. [Refer: Type of measurement of expected credit losses [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Method of assessment of expected credit losses [axis]
標準ラベル（英）: Method of assessment of expected credit losses [axis]
標準ラベル（日）: 予想信用損失の評価の方法 [軸]
定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Method of assessment of expected credit losses [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Method of assessment of expected credit losses [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 予想信用損失の評価の方法 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for all methods of assessment of expected credit losses. Expected credit losses are the weighted average of credit losses with the respective risks of a default occurring as the weights. This member also represents the standard value for the 'Method of assessment of expected credit losses' axis if no other member is used.

定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Credit impairment of financial instruments [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Credit impairment of financial instruments [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 金融商品の信用減損 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for all statuses of credit impairment of financial instruments. A financial instrument is credit-impaired when one or more events that have a detrimental impact on the estimated future cash flows of that financial instrument have occurred. This member also represents the standard value for the 'Credit impairment of financial instruments' axis if no other member is used.

定義: This member stands for financial instruments that are not credit-impaired. [Refer: Credit impairment of financial instruments [member]]

標準ラベル（英）: Financial instruments credit-impaired [member]

定義: This member stands for financial instruments that are credit-impaired. [Refer: Credit impairment of financial instruments [member]]

It also represents the standard value for the 'Carrying amount, accumulated depreciation, amortisation and impairment and gross carrying amount' axis if no other member is used. [Refer: Depreciation and amortisation expense; Impairment loss]

定義: Line items represent concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes of the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Financial assets at beginning of period
標準ラベル（英）: Financial assets
標準ラベル（日）: 金融資産
定義: The amount of assets that are: (a) cash; (b) an equity instrument of another entity; (c) a contractual right: (i) to receive cash or another financial asset from another entity; or (ii) to exchange financial assets or financial liabilities with another entity under conditions that are potentially favourable to the entity; or (d) a contract that will, or may be, settled in the entity’s own equity instruments and is: (i) a non-derivative for which the entity is, or may be, obliged to receive a variable number of the entity’s own equity instruments; or (ii) a derivative that will, or may be, settled other than by the exchange of a fixed amount of cash or another financial asset for a fixed number of the entity’s own equity instruments. For this purpose the entity’s own equity instruments do not include puttable financial instruments classified as equity instruments in accordance with paragraphs 16A-16B of IAS 32, instruments that impose on the entity an obligation to deliver to another party a pro rata share of the net assets of the entity only on liquidation and are classified as equity instruments in accordance with paragraphs 16C-16D of IAS 32, or instruments that are contracts for the future receipt or delivery of the entity’s own equity instruments. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]; Financial liabilities]

定義: The disclosure of the credit risk exposure. Credit risk exposure is the credit risk inherent in an entity’s financial assets and commitments to extend credit.

標準ラベル（英）: Type of measurement of expected credit losses [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 予想信用損失の測定の種類 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for all types of measurement of expected credit losses. Expected credit losses are the weighted average of credit losses with the respective risks of a default occurring as the weights. This member also represents the standard value for the 'Type of measurement of expected credit losses' axis if no other member is used.

定義: This member stands for the portion of lifetime expected credit losses that represent the expected credit losses that result from default events on a financial instrument that are possible within the 12 months after the reporting date. [Refer: Type of measurement of expected credit losses [member]; Lifetime expected credit losses [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of credit risk exposure [line items]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of credit risk exposure [line items]
標準ラベル（日）: 信用リスク・エクスポージャーの開示 [表示項目]
定義: Line items represent concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes of the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Financial assets
標準ラベル（英）: Financial assets
標準ラベル（日）: 金融資産
定義: The amount of assets that are: (a) cash; (b) an equity instrument of another entity; (c) a contractual right: (i) to receive cash or another financial asset from another entity; or (ii) to exchange financial assets or financial liabilities with another entity under conditions that are potentially favourable to the entity; or (d) a contract that will, or may be, settled in the entity’s own equity instruments and is: (i) a non-derivative for which the entity is, or may be, obliged to receive a variable number of the entity’s own equity instruments; or (ii) a derivative that will, or may be, settled other than by the exchange of a fixed amount of cash or another financial asset for a fixed number of the entity’s own equity instruments. For this purpose the entity’s own equity instruments do not include puttable financial instruments classified as equity instruments in accordance with paragraphs 16A-16B of IAS 32, instruments that impose on the entity an obligation to deliver to another party a pro rata share of the net assets of the entity only on liquidation and are classified as equity instruments in accordance with paragraphs 16C-16D of IAS 32, or instruments that are contracts for the future receipt or delivery of the entity’s own equity instruments. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]; Financial liabilities]

定義: The amount of the exposure to credit risk on loan commitments and financial guarantee contracts. [Refer: Loan commitments [member]; Financial guarantee contracts [member]; Credit risk [member]]

標準ラベル（英）: Accumulated impairment [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 減損損失累計額 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for accumulated impairment. [Refer: Impairment loss]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of provision matrix [line items]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of provision matrix [line items]
標準ラベル（日）: 引当マトリクスの開示 [表示項目]
定義: Line items represent concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes of the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Financial assets
標準ラベル（英）: Financial assets
標準ラベル（日）: 金融資産
定義: The amount of assets that are: (a) cash; (b) an equity instrument of another entity; (c) a contractual right: (i) to receive cash or another financial asset from another entity; or (ii) to exchange financial assets or financial liabilities with another entity under conditions that are potentially favourable to the entity; or (d) a contract that will, or may be, settled in the entity’s own equity instruments and is: (i) a non-derivative for which the entity is, or may be, obliged to receive a variable number of the entity’s own equity instruments; or (ii) a derivative that will, or may be, settled other than by the exchange of a fixed amount of cash or another financial asset for a fixed number of the entity’s own equity instruments. For this purpose the entity’s own equity instruments do not include puttable financial instruments classified as equity instruments in accordance with paragraphs 16A-16B of IAS 32, instruments that impose on the entity an obligation to deliver to another party a pro rata share of the net assets of the entity only on liquidation and are classified as equity instruments in accordance with paragraphs 16C-16D of IAS 32, or instruments that are contracts for the future receipt or delivery of the entity’s own equity instruments. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]; Financial liabilities]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Expected credit loss rate
標準ラベル（英）: Expected credit loss rate
標準ラベル（日）: 予想信用損失
定義: The rate of expected credit losses, calculated as percentage of the gross carrying amount. Expected credit losses are the weighted average of credit losses with the respective risks of a default occurring as the weights.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of financial assets that are either past due or impaired [text block]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of financial assets that are either past due or impaired [text block]
標準ラベル（日）: 期日が経過したか又は減損した金融資産の開示 [テキストブロック]
定義: The disclosure of financial assets that are either past due or impaired. [Refer: Financial assets]

標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of financial assets that are either past due or impaired [abstract]

定義: This member stands for loans made to government.

定義: This member stands for trade receivables. [Refer: Trade receivables]

標準ラベル（英）: Financial assets at fair value, class [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 公正価値で測定する金融資産（クラス） [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for the financial assets measured at fair value class. [Refer: Financial assets; At fair value [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Trading securities [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Trading securities [member]
標準ラベル（日）: トレーディング有価証券 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for financial instruments that (a) are acquired or incurred principally for the purpose of selling or repurchasing it in the near term; or (b) on initial recognition are part of a portfolio of identified financial instruments that are managed together and for which there is evidence of a recent actual pattern of short-term profit-taking. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Derivatives [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Derivatives [member]
標準ラベル（日）: デリバティブ [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for financial instruments or other contracts within the scope of IFRS 9 with all three of the following characteristics: (a) Their value changes in response to the change in a specified interest rate, financial instrument price, commodity price, foreign exchange rate, index of prices or rates, credit rating or credit index, or other variable, provided in the case of a non-financial variable that the variable is not specific to a party to the contract (sometimes called the ‘underlying’); (b) They require no initial net investment or an initial net investment that is smaller than would be required for other types of contracts that would be expected to have a similar response to changes in market factors; (c) They are settled at a future date. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Option contract [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Option contract [member]
標準ラベル（日）: オプション契約 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a derivative financial instrument that gives the holder the right, but not the obligation, to purchase or sell an underlying asset for a specified price determined in advance. [Refer: Derivatives [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Futures contract [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Futures contract [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 先物契約 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a standardised, exchange-traded contract for the purchase or sale of an underlying asset at a specified future date for a settlement price determined in advance.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Swap contract [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Swap contract [member]
標準ラベル（日）: スワップ契約 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a derivative financial instrument that involves the exchange of cash flow streams between the parties of the contract over a specified period. [Refer: Derivatives [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Financial assets
標準ラベル（英）: Financial assets
標準ラベル（日）: 金融資産
定義: The amount of assets that are: (a) cash; (b) an equity instrument of another entity; (c) a contractual right: (i) to receive cash or another financial asset from another entity; or (ii) to exchange financial assets or financial liabilities with another entity under conditions that are potentially favourable to the entity; or (d) a contract that will, or may be, settled in the entity’s own equity instruments and is: (i) a non-derivative for which the entity is, or may be, obliged to receive a variable number of the entity’s own equity instruments; or (ii) a derivative that will, or may be, settled other than by the exchange of a fixed amount of cash or another financial asset for a fixed number of the entity’s own equity instruments. For this purpose the entity’s own equity instruments do not include puttable financial instruments classified as equity instruments in accordance with paragraphs 16A-16B of IAS 32, instruments that impose on the entity an obligation to deliver to another party a pro rata share of the net assets of the entity only on liquidation and are classified as equity instruments in accordance with paragraphs 16C-16D of IAS 32, or instruments that are contracts for the future receipt or delivery of the entity’s own equity instruments. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]; Financial liabilities]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Financial liabilities
標準ラベル（英）: Financial liabilities
標準ラベル（日）: 金融負債
定義: The amount of liabilities that are: (a) a contractual obligation: (i) to deliver cash or another financial asset to another entity; or (ii) to exchange financial assets or financial liabilities with another entity under conditions that are potentially unfavourable to the entity; or (b) a contract that will, or may be, settled in the entity’s own equity instruments and is: (i) a non-derivative for which the entity is, or may be, obliged to deliver a variable number of the entity’s own equity instruments; or (ii) a derivative that will, or may be, settled other than by the exchange of a fixed amount of cash or another financial asset for a fixed number of the entity’s own equity instruments. For this purpose, rights, options or warrants to acquire a fixed number of the entity’s own equity instruments for a fixed amount of any currency are equity instruments if the entity offers the rights, options or warrants pro rata to all of its existing owners of the same class of its own non-derivative equity instruments. Also, for those purposes the entity’s own equity instruments do not include puttable financial instruments that are classified as equity instruments in accordance with paragraphs 16A-16B of IAS 32, instruments that impose on the entity an obligation to deliver to another party a pro rata share of the net assets of the entity only on liquidation and are classified as equity instruments in accordance with paragraphs 16C-16D of IAS 32, or instruments that are contracts for the future receipt or delivery of the entity’s own equity instruments. As an exception, an instrument that meets the definition of a financial liability is classified as an equity instrument if it has all the features and meets the conditions in paragraphs 16A-16B or paragraphs 16C-16D of IAS 32. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]; Financial assets; Derivatives [member]]
