表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of significant unobservable inputs used in fair value measurement of assets [text block]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of significant unobservable inputs used in fair value measurement of assets [text block]
標準ラベル（日）: 資産の公正価値測定に用いた重大な観察可能でないインプットの開示 [テキストブロック]
定義: The disclosure of significant inputs for which market data are not available and that are developed using the best information available about the assumptions that market participants would use when measuring the fair value of assets.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of significant unobservable inputs used in fair value measurement of assets [abstract]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of significant unobservable inputs used in fair value measurement of assets [abstract]
標準ラベル（日）: 資産の公正価値測定に用いた重大な観察可能でないインプットの開示 [タイトル項目]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of significant unobservable inputs used in fair value measurement of assets [table]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of significant unobservable inputs used in fair value measurement of assets [table]
標準ラベル（日）: 資産の公正価値測定に用いた重大な観察可能でないインプットの開示 [表]
定義: Schedule disclosing information related to significant unobservable inputs used in the fair value measurement of assets.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Measurement [axis]
標準ラベル（英）: Measurement [axis]
標準ラベル（日）: 測定 [軸]
定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Aggregated measurement [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Aggregated measurement [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 測定の合算 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for all types of measurement. It also represents the standard value for the 'Measurement' axis if no other member is used.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: At fair value [member]
標準ラベル（英）: At fair value [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 公正価値 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for measurement based on fair value. Fair value is the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Recurring fair value measurement [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Recurring fair value measurement [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 経常的な公正価値測定 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for fair value measurements which other IFRSs require or permit in the statement of financial position at the end of each reporting period. [Refer: IFRSs [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Non-recurring fair value measurement [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Non-recurring fair value measurement [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 非経常的な公正価値測定 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for fair value measurements which other IFRSs require or permit in the statement of financial position in particular circumstances. [Refer: IFRSs [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Not measured at fair value in statement of financial position but for which fair value is disclosed [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Not measured at fair value in statement of financial position but for which fair value is disclosed [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 財政状態計算書において公正価値で測定されていないが公正価値が開示されているもの [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for items not measured at fair value in the statement of financial position but for which fair value is disclosed. [Refer: At fair value [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Classes of assets [axis]
標準ラベル（英）: Classes of assets [axis]
標準ラベル（日）: 資産の種類 [軸]
定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Assets [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Assets [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 資産 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for resources: (a) controlled by an entity as a result of past events; and (b) from which future economic benefits are expected to flow to the entity. It also represents the standard value for the 'Classes of assets' axis if no other member is used.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Trading equity securities [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Trading equity securities [member]
標準ラベル（日）: トレーディング持分証券 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for equity instruments that (a) are acquired or incurred principally for the purpose of selling or repurchasing it in the near term; or (b) on initial recognition are part of a portfolio of identified financial instruments that are managed together and for which there is evidence of a recent actual pattern of short-term profit-taking.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Other equity securities [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Other equity securities [member]
標準ラベル（日）: その他の持分証券 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for equity instruments that the entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Debt securities [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Debt securities [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 債券 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for instruments held by the entity that represent indebtedness.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Hedge fund investments [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Hedge fund investments [member]
標準ラベル（日）: ヘッジファンド投資 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for investments in hedge funds.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Derivatives [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Derivatives [member]
標準ラベル（日）: デリバティブ [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for financial instruments or other contracts within the scope of IFRS 9 with all three of the following characteristics: (a) Their value changes in response to the change in a specified interest rate, financial instrument price, commodity price, foreign exchange rate, index of prices or rates, credit rating or credit index, or other variable, provided in the case of a non-financial variable that the variable is not specific to a party to the contract (sometimes called the ‘underlying’); (b) They require no initial net investment or an initial net investment that is smaller than would be required for other types of contracts that would be expected to have a similar response to changes in market factors; (c) They are settled at a future date. [Refer: Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Investment property [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Investment property [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 投資不動産 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for investment property. It also represents the standard value for the 'Types of investment property' axis if no other member is used. [Refer: Investment property]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Non-current assets held for sale [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Non-current assets held for sale [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 売却目的で保有する非流動資産 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for non-current assets that are available for immediate sale in their present condition, subject only to terms that are usual and customary for sales of such assets, and for which sale is highly probable. [Refer: Non-current assets]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Valuation techniques used in fair value measurement [axis]
標準ラベル（英）: Valuation techniques used in fair value measurement [axis]
標準ラベル（日）: 公正価値測定に用いた評価技法 [軸]
定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Valuation techniques [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Valuation techniques [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 評価技法 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for valuation techniques used by the entity to measure fair value. It also represents the standard value for the 'Valuation techniques used in fair value measurement' axis if no other member is used. [Refer: At fair value [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Market approach [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Market approach [member]
標準ラベル（日）: マーケット・アプローチ [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a valuation technique that uses prices and other relevant information generated by market transactions involving identical or comparable (ie similar) assets, liabilities or a group of assets and liabilities, such as a business.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Market comparable companies [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Market comparable companies [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 市場における類似会社 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a specific valuation technique consistent with the market approach that involves analysing inputs from comparable entities (for example, EBITDA multiple, revenue multiple, discount for lack of marketability, control premium) in the current market. [Refer: Market approach [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Market comparable prices [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Market comparable prices [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 類似会社の市場価格 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a specific valuation technique consistent with the market approach that involves analysing inputs from comparable prices (for example, price per square metre) in the current market. [Refer: Market approach [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Matrix pricing [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Matrix pricing [member]
標準ラベル（日）: マトリックス・プライシング [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a specific mathematical valuation technique that is consistent with the market approach that is used principally to value some types of financial instruments, such as debt instruments, without relying exclusively on quoted prices for the specific securities, but rather relying on the securities' relationship to other benchmark quoted securities. [Refer: Market approach [member]; Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Consensus pricing [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Consensus pricing [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 合意価格 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a specific valuation technique consistent with the market approach that involves analysing inputs from consensus prices (for example, offered quotes, comparability adjustments) in the market. [Refer: Market approach [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Cost approach [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Cost approach [member]
標準ラベル（日）: コスト・アプローチ [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a valuation technique that reflects the amount that would be required currently to replace the service capacity of an asset (often referred to as 'current replacement cost').

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Income approach [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Income approach [member]
標準ラベル（日）: インカム・アプローチ [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for valuation techniques that convert future amounts (for example, cash flows or income and expenses) to a single current (ie discounted) amount. The fair value measurement is determined on the basis of the value indicated by current market expectations about those future amounts.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Discounted cash flow [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Discounted cash flow [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 割引キャッシュ・フロー [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a specific valuation technique consistent with the income approach that involves analysing future cash flow amounts through the application of present value techniques and inputs (for example, weighted average cost of capital, long-term revenue growth rate, long-term pre-tax operating margin, discount for lack of marketability, control premium). [Refer: Income approach [member]; Weighted average [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Option pricing model [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Option pricing model [member]
標準ラベル（日）: オプション価格算定モデル [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a specific valuation technique consistent with the income approach that involves analysing future amounts with option pricing models, such as the Black-Scholes-Merton formula or a binominal model (ie a lattice model), that incorporate present value techniques and reflect both the time value and intrinsic value of an option. [Refer: Income approach [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Multi-period excess earnings method [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Multi-period excess earnings method [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 多期間超過収益方式 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a specific valuation technique consistent with the income approach that involves analysing the excess earnings over periods of time, and is used to measure the fair value of some intangible assets. [Refer: Income approach [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Range [axis]
標準ラベル（英）: Range [axis]
標準ラベル（日）: 範囲 [軸]
定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Ranges [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Ranges [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 範囲 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for aggregate ranges. It also represents the standard value for the 'Range' axis if no other member is used.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Bottom of range [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Bottom of range [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 範囲の下限 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for the bottom of a range.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Weighted average [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Weighted average [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 加重平均 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for an average in which each quantity to be averaged is assigned a weight that determines the relative effect of each quantity on the average.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Top of range [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Top of range [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 範囲の上限 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for top of a range.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of significant unobservable inputs used in fair value measurement of assets [line items]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of significant unobservable inputs used in fair value measurement of assets [line items]
標準ラベル（日）: 資産の公正価値測定に用いた重大な観察可能でないインプットの開示 [表示項目]
定義: Line items represent concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes of the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Interest rate, significant unobservable inputs, assets
標準ラベル（英）: Interest rate, significant unobservable inputs, assets
標準ラベル（日）: 金利：重大な観察可能でないインプット：資産
定義: Interest rate used as a significant Level 3 unobservable input for assets. [Refer: Level 3 of fair value hierarchy [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Historical volatility for shares, significant unobservable inputs, assets
標準ラベル（英）: Historical volatility for shares, significant unobservable inputs, assets
標準ラベル（日）: 株式のヒストリカル・ボラティリティ：重大な観察可能でないインプット：資産
定義: Historical volatility for shares used as a significant Level 3 unobservable input for assets. [Refer: Level 3 of fair value hierarchy [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Adjustment to mid-market consensus price, significant unobservable inputs, assets
標準ラベル（英）: Adjustment to mid-market consensus price, significant unobservable inputs, assets
標準ラベル（日）: 仲値の合意による価格に対する調整：重大な観察可能でないインプット、資産
定義: Adjustment to a mid-market consensus (non-binding) price used as a significant Level 3 unobservable input for assets. [Refer: Level 3 of fair value hierarchy [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Current estimate of future cash outflows to be paid to fulfil obligation, significant unobservable inputs, assets
標準ラベル（英）: Current estimate of future cash outflows to be paid to fulfil obligation, significant unobservable inputs, assets
標準ラベル（日）: 債務を履行するために支払うべき将来のキャッシュ・アウトフローの現在の見積り：重大な観察可能でないインプット：資産
定義: A current estimate using the entity's own data about the future cash outflows to be paid to fulfil an obligation if there is no reasonably available information that indicates that market participants would use different assumptions. This is used as a significant Level 3 unobservable input for assets. [Refer: Level 3 of fair value hierarchy [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Financial forecast of profit or loss for cash-generating unit, significant unobservable inputs, assets
標準ラベル（英）: Financial forecast of profit or loss for cash-generating unit, significant unobservable inputs, assets
標準ラベル（日）: 資金生成単位に係る純損益の財務的予測：重大な観察可能でないインプット：資産
定義: A financial forecast of profit or loss for a cash-generating unit developed using the entity's own data if there is no reasonably available information that indicates that market participants would use different assumptions. This is used as a significant Level 3 unobservable input for assets. [Refer: Level 3 of fair value hierarchy [member]; Cash-generating units [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Financial forecast of cash flows for cash-generating unit, significant unobservable inputs, assets
標準ラベル（英）: Financial forecast of cash flows for cash-generating unit, significant unobservable inputs, assets
標準ラベル（日）: 資金生成単位に係るキャッシュ・フローの財務的予測：重大な観察可能でないインプット：資産
定義: A financial forecast of cash flows for a cash-generating unit developed using the entity's own data if there is no reasonably available information that indicates that market participants would use different assumptions. This is used as a significant Level 3 unobservable input for assets. [Refer: Level 3 of fair value hierarchy [member]; Cash-generating units [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Weighted average cost of capital, significant unobservable inputs, assets
標準ラベル（英）: Weighted average cost of capital, significant unobservable inputs, assets
標準ラベル（日）: 加重平均資本コスト：重大な観察可能でないインプット：資産
定義: Weighted average cost of capital used as a significant Level 3 unobservable input for assets. [Refer: Level 3 of fair value hierarchy [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Revenue multiple, significant unobservable inputs, assets
標準ラベル（英）: Revenue multiple, significant unobservable inputs, assets
標準ラベル（日）: 収益倍率：重大な観察可能でないインプット：資産
定義: A revenue multiple used as a significant Level 3 unobservable input for assets. [Refer: Level 3 of fair value hierarchy [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Constant prepayment rate, significant unobservable inputs, assets
標準ラベル（英）: Constant prepayment rate, significant unobservable inputs, assets
標準ラベル（日）: 定常的な早期返済率：重大な観察可能でないインプット：資産
定義: Constant prepayment rate used as a significant Level 3 unobservable input for assets. [Refer: Level 3 of fair value hierarchy [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Probability of default, significant unobservable inputs, assets
標準ラベル（英）: Probability of default, significant unobservable inputs, assets
標準ラベル（日）: 債務不履行の確率：重大な観察可能でないインプット：資産
定義: Probability of default used as a significant Level 3 unobservable input for assets. [Refer: Level 3 of fair value hierarchy [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of significant unobservable inputs used in fair value measurement of liabilities [text block]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of significant unobservable inputs used in fair value measurement of liabilities [text block]
標準ラベル（日）: 負債の公正価値測定に用いた重大な観察可能でないインプットの開示 [テキストブロック]
定義: The disclosure of significant inputs for which market data are not available and that are developed using the best information available about the assumptions that market participants would use when measuring the fair value of liabilities.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of significant unobservable inputs used in fair value measurement of liabilities [abstract]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of significant unobservable inputs used in fair value measurement of liabilities [abstract]
標準ラベル（日）: 負債の公正価値測定に用いた重大な観察可能でないインプットの開示 [タイトル項目]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of significant unobservable inputs used in fair value measurement of liabilities [table]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of significant unobservable inputs used in fair value measurement of liabilities [table]
標準ラベル（日）: 負債の公正価値測定に用いた重大な観察可能でないインプットの開示 [表]
定義: Schedule disclosing information related to significant unobservable inputs used in the fair value measurement of liabilities.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Measurement [axis]
標準ラベル（英）: Measurement [axis]
標準ラベル（日）: 測定 [軸]
定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Aggregated measurement [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Aggregated measurement [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 測定の合算 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for all types of measurement. It also represents the standard value for the 'Measurement' axis if no other member is used.

標準ラベル（日）: 公正価値 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for measurement based on fair value. Fair value is the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Recurring fair value measurement [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Recurring fair value measurement [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 経常的な公正価値測定 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for fair value measurements which other IFRSs require or permit in the statement of financial position at the end of each reporting period. [Refer: IFRSs [member]]

標準ラベル（英）: Non-recurring fair value measurement [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 非経常的な公正価値測定 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for fair value measurements which other IFRSs require or permit in the statement of financial position in particular circumstances. [Refer: IFRSs [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Not measured at fair value in statement of financial position but for which fair value is disclosed [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Not measured at fair value in statement of financial position but for which fair value is disclosed [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 財政状態計算書において公正価値で測定されていないが公正価値が開示されているもの [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for items not measured at fair value in the statement of financial position but for which fair value is disclosed. [Refer: At fair value [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Classes of liabilities [axis]
標準ラベル（英）: Classes of liabilities [axis]
標準ラベル（日）: 負債のクラス [軸]
定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Liabilities [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Liabilities [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 負債 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for present obligations of the entity arising from past events, the settlement of which is expected to result in an outflow from the entity of resources embodying economic benefits. It also represents the standard value for the 'Classes of liabilities' axis if no other member is used. [Refer: Liabilities]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Valuation techniques used in fair value measurement [axis]
標準ラベル（英）: Valuation techniques used in fair value measurement [axis]
標準ラベル（日）: 公正価値測定に用いた評価技法 [軸]
定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Valuation techniques [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Valuation techniques [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 評価技法 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for valuation techniques used by the entity to measure fair value. It also represents the standard value for the 'Valuation techniques used in fair value measurement' axis if no other member is used. [Refer: At fair value [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Market approach [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Market approach [member]
標準ラベル（日）: マーケット・アプローチ [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a valuation technique that uses prices and other relevant information generated by market transactions involving identical or comparable (ie similar) assets, liabilities or a group of assets and liabilities, such as a business.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Market comparable companies [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Market comparable companies [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 市場における類似会社 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a specific valuation technique consistent with the market approach that involves analysing inputs from comparable entities (for example, EBITDA multiple, revenue multiple, discount for lack of marketability, control premium) in the current market. [Refer: Market approach [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Market comparable prices [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Market comparable prices [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 類似会社の市場価格 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a specific valuation technique consistent with the market approach that involves analysing inputs from comparable prices (for example, price per square metre) in the current market. [Refer: Market approach [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Matrix pricing [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Matrix pricing [member]
標準ラベル（日）: マトリックス・プライシング [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a specific mathematical valuation technique that is consistent with the market approach that is used principally to value some types of financial instruments, such as debt instruments, without relying exclusively on quoted prices for the specific securities, but rather relying on the securities' relationship to other benchmark quoted securities. [Refer: Market approach [member]; Financial instruments, class [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Consensus pricing [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Consensus pricing [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 合意価格 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a specific valuation technique consistent with the market approach that involves analysing inputs from consensus prices (for example, offered quotes, comparability adjustments) in the market. [Refer: Market approach [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Cost approach [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Cost approach [member]
標準ラベル（日）: コスト・アプローチ [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a valuation technique that reflects the amount that would be required currently to replace the service capacity of an asset (often referred to as 'current replacement cost').

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Income approach [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Income approach [member]
標準ラベル（日）: インカム・アプローチ [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for valuation techniques that convert future amounts (for example, cash flows or income and expenses) to a single current (ie discounted) amount. The fair value measurement is determined on the basis of the value indicated by current market expectations about those future amounts.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Discounted cash flow [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Discounted cash flow [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 割引キャッシュ・フロー [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a specific valuation technique consistent with the income approach that involves analysing future cash flow amounts through the application of present value techniques and inputs (for example, weighted average cost of capital, long-term revenue growth rate, long-term pre-tax operating margin, discount for lack of marketability, control premium). [Refer: Income approach [member]; Weighted average [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Option pricing model [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Option pricing model [member]
標準ラベル（日）: オプション価格算定モデル [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a specific valuation technique consistent with the income approach that involves analysing future amounts with option pricing models, such as the Black-Scholes-Merton formula or a binominal model (ie a lattice model), that incorporate present value techniques and reflect both the time value and intrinsic value of an option. [Refer: Income approach [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Multi-period excess earnings method [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Multi-period excess earnings method [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 多期間超過収益方式 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a specific valuation technique consistent with the income approach that involves analysing the excess earnings over periods of time, and is used to measure the fair value of some intangible assets. [Refer: Income approach [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Range [axis]
標準ラベル（英）: Range [axis]
標準ラベル（日）: 範囲 [軸]
定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Ranges [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Ranges [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 範囲 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for aggregate ranges. It also represents the standard value for the 'Range' axis if no other member is used.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Bottom of range [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Bottom of range [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 範囲の下限 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for the bottom of a range.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Weighted average [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Weighted average [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 加重平均 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for an average in which each quantity to be averaged is assigned a weight that determines the relative effect of each quantity on the average.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Top of range [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Top of range [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 範囲の上限 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for top of a range.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of significant unobservable inputs used in fair value measurement of liabilities [line items]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of significant unobservable inputs used in fair value measurement of liabilities [line items]
標準ラベル（日）: 負債の公正価値測定に用いた重大な観察可能でないインプットの開示 [表示項目]
定義: Line items represent concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes of the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Interest rate, significant unobservable inputs, liabilities
標準ラベル（英）: Interest rate, significant unobservable inputs, liabilities
標準ラベル（日）: 金利：重大な観察可能でないインプット：負債
定義: Interest rate used as a significant Level 3 unobservable input for liabilities. [Refer: Level 3 of fair value hierarchy [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Historical volatility for shares, significant unobservable inputs, liabilities
標準ラベル（英）: Historical volatility for shares, significant unobservable inputs, liabilities
標準ラベル（日）: 株式のヒストリカル・ボラティリティ：重大な観察可能でないインプット：負債
定義: Historical volatility for shares used as a significant Level 3 unobservable input for liabilities. [Refer: Level 3 of fair value hierarchy [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Adjustment to mid-market consensus price, significant unobservable inputs, liabilities
標準ラベル（英）: Adjustment to mid-market consensus price, significant unobservable inputs, liabilities
標準ラベル（日）: 仲値の合意による価格に対する調整：重大な観察可能でないインプット、負債
定義: Adjustment to a mid-market consensus (non-binding) price used as a significant Level 3 unobservable input for liabilities. [Refer: Level 3 of fair value hierarchy [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Current estimate of future cash outflows to be paid to fulfil obligation, significant unobservable inputs, liabilities
標準ラベル（英）: Current estimate of future cash outflows to be paid to fulfil obligation, significant unobservable inputs, liabilities
標準ラベル（日）: 債務を履行するために支払うべき将来のキャッシュ・アウトフローの現在の見積り：重大な観察可能でないインプット：負債
定義: A current estimate using the entity's own data about the future cash outflows to be paid to fulfil an obligation if there is no reasonably available information that indicates that market participants would use different assumptions. This is used as a significant Level 3 unobservable input for liabilities. [Refer: Level 3 of fair value hierarchy [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Financial forecast of profit or loss for cash-generating unit, significant unobservable inputs, liabilities
標準ラベル（英）: Financial forecast of profit or loss for cash-generating unit, significant unobservable inputs, liabilities
標準ラベル（日）: 資金生成単位に係る純損益の財務的予測：重大な観察可能でないインプット：負債
定義: A financial forecast of profit or loss for a cash-generating unit developed using the entity's own data if there is no reasonably available information that indicates that market participants would use different assumptions. This is used as a significant Level 3 unobservable input for liabilities. [Refer: Level 3 of fair value hierarchy [member]; Cash-generating units [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Financial forecast of cash flows for cash-generating unit, significant unobservable inputs, liabilities
標準ラベル（英）: Financial forecast of cash flows for cash-generating unit, significant unobservable inputs, liabilities
標準ラベル（日）: 資金生成単位に係るキャッシュ・フローの財務的予測：重大な観察可能でないインプット：負債
定義: A financial forecast of cash flows for a cash-generating unit developed using the entity's own data if there is no reasonably available information that indicates that market participants would use different assumptions. This is used as a significant Level 3 unobservable input for liabilities. [Refer: Level 3 of fair value hierarchy [member]; Cash-generating units [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Weighted average cost of capital, significant unobservable inputs, liabilities
標準ラベル（英）: Weighted average cost of capital, significant unobservable inputs, liabilities
標準ラベル（日）: 加重平均資本コスト：重大な観察可能でないインプット：負債
定義: Weighted average cost of capital used as a significant Level 3 unobservable input for liabilities. [Refer: Level 3 of fair value hierarchy [member]; Weighted average [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Revenue multiple, significant unobservable inputs, liabilities
標準ラベル（英）: Revenue multiple, significant unobservable inputs, liabilities
標準ラベル（日）: 収益倍率：重大な観察可能でないインプット：負債
定義: A revenue multiple used as a significant Level 3 unobservable input for liabilities. [Refer: Level 3 of fair value hierarchy [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Constant prepayment rate, significant unobservable inputs, liabilities
標準ラベル（英）: Constant prepayment rate, significant unobservable inputs, liabilities
標準ラベル（日）: 定常的な早期返済率：重大な観察可能でないインプット：負債
定義: Constant prepayment rate used as a significant Level 3 unobservable input for liabilities. [Refer: Level 3 of fair value hierarchy [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Probability of default, significant unobservable inputs, liabilities
標準ラベル（英）: Probability of default, significant unobservable inputs, liabilities
標準ラベル（日）: 債務不履行の確率：重大な観察可能でないインプット：負債
定義: Probability of default used as a significant Level 3 unobservable input for liabilities. [Refer: Level 3 of fair value hierarchy [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of significant unobservable inputs used in fair value measurement of equity [text block]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of significant unobservable inputs used in fair value measurement of equity [text block]
標準ラベル（日）: 資本の公正価値測定に用いた重大な観察可能でないインプットの開示 [テキストブロック]
定義: The disclosure of significant inputs for which market data are not available and that are developed using the best information available about the assumptions that market participants would use when measuring the fair value of the entity's own equity instruments. [Refer: Entity's own equity instruments [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of significant unobservable inputs used in fair value measurement of equity [abstract]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of significant unobservable inputs used in fair value measurement of equity [abstract]
標準ラベル（日）: 資本の公正価値測定に用いた重大な観察可能でないインプットの開示 [タイトル項目]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of significant unobservable inputs used in fair value measurement of equity [table]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of significant unobservable inputs used in fair value measurement of equity [table]
標準ラベル（日）: 資本の公正価値測定に用いた重大な観察可能でないインプットの開示 [表]
定義: Schedule disclosing information related to significant unobservable inputs used in the fair value measurement of equity.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Measurement [axis]
標準ラベル（英）: Measurement [axis]
標準ラベル（日）: 測定 [軸]
定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Aggregated measurement [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Aggregated measurement [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 測定の合算 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for all types of measurement. It also represents the standard value for the 'Measurement' axis if no other member is used.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: At fair value [member]
標準ラベル（英）: At fair value [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 公正価値 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for measurement based on fair value. Fair value is the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Recurring fair value measurement [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Recurring fair value measurement [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 経常的な公正価値測定 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for fair value measurements which other IFRSs require or permit in the statement of financial position at the end of each reporting period. [Refer: IFRSs [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Non-recurring fair value measurement [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Non-recurring fair value measurement [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 非経常的な公正価値測定 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for fair value measurements which other IFRSs require or permit in the statement of financial position in particular circumstances. [Refer: IFRSs [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Not measured at fair value in statement of financial position but for which fair value is disclosed [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Not measured at fair value in statement of financial position but for which fair value is disclosed [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 財政状態計算書において公正価値で測定されていないが公正価値が開示されているもの [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for items not measured at fair value in the statement of financial position but for which fair value is disclosed. [Refer: At fair value [member]]

標準ラベル（日）: 顧客関連の無形資産 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a class of intangible assets representing assets related to customers. Such assets may include customer lists, order or production backlog, customer contracts and related customer relationships as well as non-contractual customer relationships.

標準ラベル（日）: 取得した事業の価値 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a class of intangible assets representing the difference between (a) the fair value of the contractual insurance rights acquired and the insurance obligations assumed in a business combination; and (b) the amount of liability measured in accordance with the insurer’s accounting policies for insurance contracts that it issues. [Refer: Business combinations [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Capitalised development expenditure [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Capitalised development expenditure [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 資産化した開発支出 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a class of intangible assets arising from development expenditure capitalised before the start of commercial production or use. An intangible asset shall only be recognised if the entity can demonstrate all of the following: (a) the technical feasibility of completing the intangible asset so that it will be available for use or sale; (b) its intention to complete the intangible asset and use or sell it; (c) its ability to use or sell the intangible asset; (d) how the intangible asset will generate probable future economic benefits. Among other things, the entity can demonstrate the existence of a market for the output of the intangible asset or the intangible asset itself or, if it is to be used internally, the usefulness of the intangible asset; (e) the availability of adequate technical, financial and other resources to complete the development and to use or sell the intangible asset; and (f) its ability to measure reliably the expenditure attributable to the intangible asset during its development.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Intangible assets under development [member]

定義: This member stands for a class of intangible assets representing such assets under development. [Refer: Intangible assets other than goodwill]

定義: This member stands for a class of intangible assets representing assets based on technology. Such assets may include patented and unpatented technology, databases as well as trade secrets. [Refer: Intangible assets other than goodwill]

定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Intangible assets and goodwill [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Intangible assets and goodwill [member]

定義: This member stands for intangible assets and goodwill. It also represents the standard value for the 'Classes of intangible assets and goodwill' axis if no other member is used. [Refer: Goodwill; Intangible assets other than goodwill]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Intangible assets other than goodwill [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Intangible assets other than goodwill [member]
標準ラベル（日）: のれん以外の無形資産 [メンバー]

標準ラベル（日）: 題字及び出版表題 [メンバー]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Licences [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Licences [member]
標準ラベル（日）: ライセンス [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a class of intangible assets representing the right to use certain intangible assets owned by another entity. [Refer: Intangible assets other than goodwill]

標準ラベル（英）: GSM licences [member]

標準ラベル（日）: UMTSライセンス [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for Universal Mobile Telecommunications System licenses. [Refer: Licences and franchises]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: LTE licences [member]
標準ラベル（英）: LTE licences [member]
標準ラベル（日）: LTEライセンス [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for Long Term Evolution licenses. [Refer: Licences and franchises]

定義: This member stands for a class of intangible assets representing the right to operate a business using the name, merchandise, services, methodologies, promotional support, marketing and supplies granted by another entity. [Refer: Intangible assets other than goodwill]

定義: This member stands for a class of intangible assets representing copyrights, patents and other industrial property rights, service and operating rights. [Refer: Intangible assets other than goodwill]

定義: This member stands for broadcasting rights.

定義: This member stands for service concession rights. [Refer: Service concession arrangements [member]]

標準ラベル（英）: Recipes, formulae, models, designs and prototypes [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 配合、製法、モデル、デザイン及び試作品 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a class of intangible assets representing recipes, formulae, models, designs and prototypes. [Refer: Intangible assets other than goodwill]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Customer-related intangible assets [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Customer-related intangible assets [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 顧客関連の無形資産 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a class of intangible assets representing assets related to customers. Such assets may include customer lists, order or production backlog, customer contracts and related customer relationships as well as non-contractual customer relationships.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Value of business acquired [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Value of business acquired [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 取得した事業の価値 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a class of intangible assets representing the difference between (a) the fair value of the contractual insurance rights acquired and the insurance obligations assumed in a business combination; and (b) the amount of liability measured in accordance with the insurer’s accounting policies for insurance contracts that it issues. [Refer: Business combinations [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Capitalised development expenditure [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Capitalised development expenditure [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 資産化した開発支出 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a class of intangible assets arising from development expenditure capitalised before the start of commercial production or use. An intangible asset shall only be recognised if the entity can demonstrate all of the following: (a) the technical feasibility of completing the intangible asset so that it will be available for use or sale; (b) its intention to complete the intangible asset and use or sell it; (c) its ability to use or sell the intangible asset; (d) how the intangible asset will generate probable future economic benefits. Among other things, the entity can demonstrate the existence of a market for the output of the intangible asset or the intangible asset itself or, if it is to be used internally, the usefulness of the intangible asset; (e) the availability of adequate technical, financial and other resources to complete the development and to use or sell the intangible asset; and (f) its ability to measure reliably the expenditure attributable to the intangible asset during its development.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Intangible assets under development [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Intangible assets under development [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 開発中の無形資産 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a class of intangible assets representing such assets under development. [Refer: Intangible assets other than goodwill]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Technology-based intangible assets [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Technology-based intangible assets [member]
標準ラベル（日）: テクノロジーを基礎とした無形資産 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a class of intangible assets representing assets based on technology. Such assets may include patented and unpatented technology, databases as well as trade secrets. [Refer: Intangible assets other than goodwill]

定義: This member stands for a class of intangible assets that the entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. [Refer: Intangible assets other than goodwill]

標準ラベル（英）: Carrying amount, accumulated depreciation, amortisation and impairment and gross carrying amount [axis]
標準ラベル（日）: 帳簿価額、減価償却、償却及び減損の累計額、並びに償却累計額控除前の帳簿価額 [軸]
定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Carrying amount [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Carrying amount [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 帳簿価額 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for the amount at which an asset is recognised in the statement of financial position (after deducting any accumulated depreciation or amortisation and accumulated impairment losses). It also represents the standard value for the 'Carrying amount, accumulated depreciation, amortisation and impairment and gross carrying amount' axis if no other member is used. [Refer: Depreciation and amortisation expense; Impairment loss]

標準ラベル（英）: Accumulated depreciation and amortisation [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 減価償却及び償却の累計額 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for accumulated depreciation and amortisation. [Refer: Depreciation and amortisation expense]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Increase (decrease) through other changes, intangible assets and goodwill
標準ラベル（英）: Increase (decrease) through other changes, intangible assets and goodwill

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of identity of rate regulator(s)
標準ラベル（英）: Description of identity of rate regulator(s)
標準ラベル（日）: 規制機関の個別特定の記述
定義: The description of the identity of the rate regulator(s). A rate regulator is an authorised body that is empowered by statute or regulation to establish the rate or a range of rates that bind an entity. The rate regulator may be a third-party body or a related party of the entity, including the entity’s own governing board, if that body is required by statute or regulation to set rates both in the interest of the customers and to ensure the overall financial viability of the entity.

標準ラベル（日）: 規制繰延勘定残高 [軸]
定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Regulatory deferral account balances [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Regulatory deferral account balances [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 規制繰延勘定残高 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for regulatory deferral account balances. A regulatory deferral account balance is the balance of any expense (or income) account that would not be recognised as an asset or a liability in accordance with other Standards, but that qualifies for deferral because it is included, or is expected to be included, by the rate regulator in establishing the rate(s) that can be charged to customers. This member also represents the standard value for the 'Regulatory deferral account balances' axis if no other member is used.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Regulatory deferral account balances not classified as disposal groups [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Regulatory deferral account balances not classified as disposal groups [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 処分グループに分類されなかった規制繰延勘定残高 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for regulatory deferral account balances that are not classified as disposal groups. [Refer: Disposal groups classified as held for sale [member]; Regulatory deferral account balances [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Regulatory deferral account balances classified as disposal groups [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Regulatory deferral account balances classified as disposal groups [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 処分グループに分類された規制繰延勘定残高 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for regulatory deferral account balances that are classified as disposal groups. [Refer: Disposal groups classified as held for sale [member]; Regulatory deferral account balances [member]]

標準ラベル（英）: Classes of regulatory deferral account balances [axis]
標準ラベル（日）: 規制繰延勘定残高の種類 [軸]
定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

標準ラベル（英）: Classes of regulatory deferral account balances [member]

定義: This member stands for all classes (ie types of cost or income) of regulatory deferral account balances. It also represents the standard value for the 'Classes of regulatory deferral account balances' axis if no other member is used. [Refer: Regulatory deferral account balances [member]]

標準ラベル（日）: 投資不動産に関する詳細情報の開示 [テキストブロック]
定義: The disclosure of detailed information about investment property. [Refer: Investment property]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of detailed information about investment property [abstract]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of detailed information about investment property [abstract]
標準ラベル（日）: 投資不動産に関する詳細情報の開示 [タイトル項目]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of detailed information about investment property [table]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of detailed information about investment property [table]
標準ラベル（日）: 投資不動産に関する詳細情報の開示 [表]
定義: Schedule disclosing information related to details of investment property.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Measurement [axis]
標準ラベル（英）: Measurement [axis]
標準ラベル（日）: 測定 [軸]
定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Aggregated measurement [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Aggregated measurement [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 測定の合算 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for all types of measurement. It also represents the standard value for the 'Measurement' axis if no other member is used.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: At cost [member]
標準ラベル（英）: At cost [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 取得原価 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for measurement based on cost. Cost is the amount of cash or cash equivalents paid or the fair value of the other consideration given to acquire an asset at the time of its acquisition or construction, or, when applicable, the amount attributed to that asset when initially recognised in accordance with the specific requirements of other IFRSs.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Fair value model [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Fair value model [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 公正価値モデル [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for measurement using the fair value model. Fair value is the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: At fair value [member]
標準ラベル（英）: At fair value [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 公正価値 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for measurement based on fair value. Fair value is the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: At cost within fair value model [member]
標準ラベル（英）: At cost within fair value model [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 公正価値モデルにおける例外としての取得原価 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for measurement based on cost when the fair value model is generally used by the entity to measure a class of assets. [Refer: At cost [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: At cost or in accordance with IFRS 16 within fair value model [member]
標準ラベル（英）: At cost or in accordance with IFRS 16 within fair value model [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 公正価値モデルにおける例外としての取得原価又はIFRS第16号に従った測定 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for measurement based on cost or IFRS 16 when the fair value model is generally used by the entity to measure a class of assets. [Refer: At cost [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Carrying amount, accumulated depreciation, amortisation and impairment and gross carrying amount [axis]
標準ラベル（英）: Carrying amount, accumulated depreciation, amortisation and impairment and gross carrying amount [axis]
標準ラベル（日）: 帳簿価額、減価償却、償却及び減損の累計額、並びに償却累計額控除前の帳簿価額 [軸]
定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Carrying amount [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Carrying amount [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 帳簿価額 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for the amount at which an asset is recognised in the statement of financial position (after deducting any accumulated depreciation or amortisation and accumulated impairment losses). It also represents the standard value for the 'Carrying amount, accumulated depreciation, amortisation and impairment and gross carrying amount' axis if no other member is used. [Refer: Depreciation and amortisation expense; Impairment loss]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Gross carrying amount [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Gross carrying amount [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 減価償却累計額控除前の帳簿価額 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for the amount at which an asset is recognised before deducting any accumulated depreciation (amortisation) and accumulated impairment losses thereon. [Refer: Depreciation and amortisation expense; Impairment loss]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Accumulated depreciation, amortisation and impairment [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Accumulated depreciation, amortisation and impairment [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 減価償却、償却及び減損の累計額 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for accumulated depreciation, amortisation and impairment. [Refer: Impairment loss; Depreciation and amortisation expense]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Accumulated depreciation and amortisation [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Accumulated depreciation and amortisation [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 減価償却及び償却の累計額 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for accumulated depreciation and amortisation. [Refer: Depreciation and amortisation expense]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Accumulated impairment [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Accumulated impairment [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 減損損失累計額 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for accumulated impairment. [Refer: Impairment loss]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Types of investment property [axis]
標準ラベル（英）: Types of investment property [axis]
標準ラベル（日）: 投資不動産の種類 [軸]
定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Investment property [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Investment property [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 投資不動産 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for investment property. It also represents the standard value for the 'Types of investment property' axis if no other member is used. [Refer: Investment property]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Investment property completed [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Investment property completed [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 完成した投資不動産 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for completed investment property. [Refer: Investment property completed]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Investment property under construction or development [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Investment property under construction or development [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 建設中又は開発中の投資不動産 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for investment property under construction or development. [Refer: Investment property under construction or development]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of detailed information about investment property [line items]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of detailed information about investment property [line items]
標準ラベル（日）: 投資不動産に関する詳細情報の開示 [表示項目]
定義: Line items represent concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes of the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Reconciliation of changes in investment property [abstract]
標準ラベル（英）: Reconciliation of changes in investment property [abstract]
標準ラベル（日）: 投資不動産の増減の調整表 [タイトル項目]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Investment property at beginning of period
標準ラベル（英）: Investment property
標準ラベル（日）: 投資不動産
定義: Expiry date 2019-01-01: The amount of property (land or a building - or part of a building - or both) held (by the owner or by the lessee under a finance lease) to earn rentals or for capital appreciation or both, rather than for: (a) use in the production or supply of goods or services or for administrative purposes; or (b) sale in the ordinary course of business. Effective 2019-01-01: The amount of property (land or a building - or part of a building - or both) held (by the owner or by the lessee as a right-of-use asset) to earn rentals or for capital appreciation or both, rather than for: (a) use in the production or supply of goods or services or for administrative purposes; or (b) sale in the ordinary course of business.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Changes in investment property [abstract]
標準ラベル（英）: Changes in investment property [abstract]
標準ラベル（日）: 投資不動産の増減 [タイトル項目]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Additions, investment property [abstract]
標準ラベル（英）: Additions, investment property [abstract]
標準ラベル（日）: 増加：投資不動産 [タイトル項目]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Additions from subsequent expenditure recognised as asset, investment property
標準ラベル（英）: Additions from subsequent expenditure recognised as asset, investment property
標準ラベル（日）: 資産として認識した事後的支出による増加：投資不動産
定義: The amount of additions to investment property resulting from subsequent expenditure recognised as an asset. [Refer: Investment property]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Additions from acquisitions, investment property
標準ラベル（英）: Additions from acquisitions, investment property
標準ラベル（日）: 取得による増加：投資不動産
定義: The amount of additions to investment property resulting from acquisitions. [Refer: Investment property]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Total additions other than through business combinations, investment property
標準ラベル（英）: Additions other than through business combinations, investment property
標準ラベル（日）: 企業結合以外による増加：投資不動産
定義: The amount of additions to investment property other than those acquired through business combinations. [Refer: Business combinations [member]; Investment property]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Acquisitions through business combinations, investment property
標準ラベル（英）: Acquisitions through business combinations, investment property
標準ラベル（日）: 企業結合による取得：投資不動産
定義: The increase in investment property resulting from acquisitions through business combinations. [Refer: Business combinations [member]; Investment property]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Increase (decrease) through net exchange differences, investment property
標準ラベル（英）: Increase (decrease) through net exchange differences, investment property
標準ラベル（日）: 正味の為替換算差額による増加（減少）：投資不動産
定義: The increase (decrease) in investment property resulting from net exchange differences arising on the translation of the financial statements from the functional currency into a different presentation currency, including the translation of a foreign operation into the presentation currency of the reporting entity. [Refer: Investment property]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Depreciation, investment property
標準ラベル（英）: Depreciation, investment property
標準ラベル（日）: 減価償却額：投資不動産
定義: The amount of depreciation recognised on investment property. [Refer: Depreciation and amortisation expense; Investment property]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Impairment loss recognised in profit or loss, investment property
標準ラベル（英）: Impairment loss recognised in profit or loss, investment property
標準ラベル（日）: 純損益に認識した減損損失：投資不動産
定義: The amount of impairment loss recognised in profit or loss for investment property. [Refer: Impairment loss recognised in profit or loss; Investment property]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Reversal of impairment loss recognised in profit or loss, investment property
標準ラベル（英）: Reversal of impairment loss recognised in profit or loss, investment property
標準ラベル（日）: 純損益に認識した減損損失の戻入れ：投資不動産
定義: The amount of reversal of impairment loss recognised in profit or loss for investment property. [Refer: Reversal of impairment loss recognised in profit or loss; Investment property]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Gains (losses) on fair value adjustment, investment property
標準ラベル（英）: Gains (losses) on fair value adjustment, investment property
標準ラベル（日）: 公正価値修正に係る利得（損失）：投資不動産
定義: The gains (losses) from changes in the fair value of investment property. [Refer: Investment property]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Transfer from (to) inventories and owner-occupied property, investment property
標準ラベル（英）: Transfer from (to) inventories and owner-occupied property, investment property
標準ラベル（日）: 棚卸資産及び自己使用不動産からの（への）振替：投資不動産
定義: The amount transferred from (to) inventories and owner-occupied property to (from) investment property. [Refer: Inventories; Investment property]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Transfer from investment property under construction or development, investment property
標準ラベル（英）: Transfer from investment property under construction or development, investment property
標準ラベル（日）: 建設中又は開発中の投資不動産からの振替：投資不動産
定義: The amount transferred from investment property under construction or development to completed investment property. [Refer: Investment property]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disposals, investment property
標準ラベル（英）: Disposals, investment property
標準ラベル（日）: 処分：投資不動産
定義: The decrease in investment property resulting from disposals. [Refer: Investment property]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Decrease through classified as held for sale, investment property
標準ラベル（英）: Decrease through classified as held for sale, investment property
標準ラベル（日）: 売却目的保有への分類による減少：投資不動産
定義: The decrease in investment property through classification as held for sale or inclusion in a disposal group classified as held for sale. [Refer: Disposal groups classified as held for sale [member]; Property, plant and equipment; Investment property; Disposal groups classified as held for sale [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Increase (decrease) through other changes, investment property
標準ラベル（英）: Increase (decrease) through other changes, investment property
標準ラベル（日）: その他の変動による増加（減少）：投資不動産
定義: The increase (decrease) in investment property resulting from changes that the entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. [Refer: Investment property]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Total increase (decrease) in investment property
標準ラベル（英）: Increase (decrease) in investment property
標準ラベル（日）: 投資不動産の増加（減少）
定義: The increase (decrease) in investment property. [Refer: Investment property]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Investment property at end of period
標準ラベル（英）: Investment property
標準ラベル（日）: 投資不動産
定義: Expiry date 2019-01-01: The amount of property (land or a building - or part of a building - or both) held (by the owner or by the lessee under a finance lease) to earn rentals or for capital appreciation or both, rather than for: (a) use in the production or supply of goods or services or for administrative purposes; or (b) sale in the ordinary course of business. Effective 2019-01-01: The amount of property (land or a building - or part of a building - or both) held (by the owner or by the lessee as a right-of-use asset) to earn rentals or for capital appreciation or both, rather than for: (a) use in the production or supply of goods or services or for administrative purposes; or (b) sale in the ordinary course of business.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Explanation of whether entity applied fair value model or cost model to measure investment property
標準ラベル（英）: Explanation of whether entity applied fair value model or cost model to measure investment property
標準ラベル（日）: 企業が投資不動産の測定に公正価値モデルと原価モデルのいずれを適用したかの説明
定義: The explanation of whether the entity applied the fair value model or the cost model to measure investment property. [Refer: Fair value model [member]; At cost [member]; Investment property]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Explanation of circumstances under which operating leases classified as investment property
標準ラベル（英）: Explanation of circumstances under which operating leases classified as investment property
標準ラベル（日）: オペレーティング・リースが投資不動産に分類されている状況の説明
定義: The explanation, if the entity applies the fair value model, of whether, and in what circumstances, property interests held under operating leases are classified and accounted for as investment property. [Refer: Fair value model [member]; Investment property]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of criteria used to distinguish investment property from owner-occupied property and from property held for sale in ordinary course of business
標準ラベル（英）: Description of criteria used to distinguish investment property from owner-occupied property and from property held for sale in ordinary course of business
標準ラベル（日）: 投資不動産を自己使用不動産及び通常の営業過程において販売目的で保有する不動産から区別するために用いた規準の記述
定義: The description of the criteria used to distinguish investment property from owner-occupied property and from property held for sale in the ordinary course of business when the classification of property as investment property is difficult. [Refer: Investment property]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of extent to which fair value of investment property is based on valuation by independent valuer
標準ラベル（英）: Description of extent to which fair value of investment property is based on valuation by independent valuer
標準ラベル（日）: 投資不動産の公正価値がどの程度、独立の鑑定人による評価に基づいているのかの記述
定義: The description of the extent to which the fair value of investment property (as measured or disclosed in the financial statements) is based on a valuation by an independent valuer who holds a recognised and relevant professional qualification and has recent experience in the location and category of the investment property being valued. [Refer: Investment property]

標準ラベル（英）: Rental income from investment property

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Direct operating expense from investment property [abstract]
標準ラベル（英）: Direct operating expense from investment property [abstract]
標準ラベル（日）: 投資不動産からの直接営業費用 [タイトル項目]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Direct operating expense from investment property generating rental income

定義: The amount of direct operating expenses (including repairs and maintenance) arising from investment property that generated rental income during the period recognised in profit or loss. [Refer: Investment property]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Direct operating expense from investment property not generating rental income
標準ラベル（英）: Direct operating expense from investment property not generating rental income

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Total direct operating expense from investment property
標準ラベル（英）: Direct operating expense from investment property
標準ラベル（日）: 投資不動産からの直接営業費用
定義: The amount of direct operating expenses (including repairs and maintenance) arising from investment property. [Refer: Investment property]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Rental income from investment property, net of direct operating expense
標準ラベル（英）: Rental income from investment property, net of direct operating expense
標準ラベル（日）: 投資不動産からの賃貸収益（直接営業費用控除後）
定義: The amount of rental income arising from investment property, net of direct operating expense from such property. [Refer: Direct operating expense from investment property; Rental income from investment property]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Cumulative change in fair value recognised in profit or loss on sales of investment property between pools of assets measured using different models
標準ラベル（英）: Cumulative change in fair value recognised in profit or loss on sales of investment property between pools of assets measured using different models
標準ラベル（日）: 異なるモデルを使用して測定される資産プール間での投資不動産の売却について純損益に認識した公正価値の変動累計額
定義: The cumulative change in fair value recognised in profit or loss on sales of investment property from a pool of assets in which the cost model is used into a pool in which the fair value model is used. [Refer: Fair value model [member]; Investment property]

標準ラベル（英）: Explanation of restrictions on realisability of investment property or remittance of income and proceeds of disposal of investment property

定義: The explanation of the existence of restrictions on the realisability of investment property or the remittance of income and proceeds on the disposal of investment property. [Refer: Investment property]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Restrictions on realisability of investment property or remittance of income and proceeds of disposal of investment property
標準ラベル（英）: Restrictions on realisability of investment property or remittance of income and proceeds of disposal of investment property
標準ラベル（日）: 投資不動産の実現可能性又は投資不動産の収益及び売却収入の送金に対する制限
定義: The amount of restrictions on the realisability of investment property or the remittance of income and proceeds of disposal. [Refer: Investment property]

標準ラベル（英）: Explanation of contractual obligations to purchase, construct or develop investment property or for repairs, maintenance or enhancements
標準ラベル（日）: 投資不動産の購入、建設若しくは開発又は修繕、維持若しくは改良のための契約上の債務の説明

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of significant adjustments to valuation obtained [text block]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of significant adjustments to valuation obtained [text block]
標準ラベル（日）: 入手した評価額の大幅な修正の開示 [テキストブロック]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of investment property, at cost within fair value model
標準ラベル（英）: Description of investment property, at cost within fair value model
標準ラベル（日）: 投資不動産の記述（公正価値モデルにおける例外としての取得原価）
