定義: The disclosure of the reconciliation between the investment derecognised and the assets and liabilities recognised on the transition from the equity method to accounting for assets and liabilities.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of reconciliation between investment derecognised and assets and liabilities recognised, transition from accounting for investment at cost or in accordance with IFRS 9 to accounting for assets and liabilities [text block]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of reconciliation between investment derecognised and assets and liabilities recognised, transition from accounting for investment at cost or in accordance with IFRS 9 to accounting for assets and liabilities [text block]
標準ラベル（日）: 認識の中止をした投資と認識した資産及び負債との間の調整表の開示：取得原価又はIFRS第9号に従った投資の会計処理から資産及び負債の会計処理への移行 [テキストブロック]
定義: The disclosure of the reconciliation between the investment derecognised and the assets and liabilities recognised on the transition from accounting for investment at cost or in accordance with IFRS 9 to accounting for assets and liabilities.

標準ラベル（英）: Cash flows from (used in) operating activities, discontinued operations

標準ラベル（英）: Cash flows from (used in) investing activities, discontinued operations

定義: The cash flows from (used in) the entity's investing activities, related to discontinued operations. [Refer: Discontinued operations [member]; Cash flows from (used in) investing activities]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Explanation of nature and adjustments to amounts previously presented in discontinued operations
標準ラベル（英）: Explanation of nature and adjustments to amounts previously presented in discontinued operations
標準ラベル（日）: 過去に非継続事業に表示されていた金額の内容及び修正の説明
定義: The explanation of the nature and amount of adjustments in the current period to amounts previously presented in discontinued operations that are directly related to the disposal of a discontinued operation in a prior period. These adjustments may arise in such circumstances as: (a) the resolution of uncertainties that arise from the terms of the disposal transaction, such as the resolution of purchase price adjustments and indemnification issues with the purchaser; (b) the resolution of uncertainties that arise from and are directly related to the operations of the component before its disposal, such as environmental and product warranty obligations retained by the seller; and (c) the settlement of employee benefit plan obligations, provided that the settlement is directly related to the disposal transaction. [Refer: Discontinued operations [member]]

定義: The explanation of the effect of the decision to change the plan to sell non-current assets or disposal groups on the results of operations for prior periods presented. [Refer: Non-current assets or disposal groups classified as held for sale]

定義: This member stands for a provision for restructuring, such as the sale or termination of a line of business; closure of business locations in a country or region or relocation of activities from one country or region to another; changes in management structure; and fundamental reorganisations that have a material effect on the nature and focus of the entity's operations. [Refer: Other provisions [member]]

標準ラベル（日）: 返金引当金 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a provision for refunds to be made by the entity to its customers. [Refer: Other provisions [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Provision for taxes other than income tax [member]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Classes of contingent liabilities [axis]
標準ラベル（英）: Classes of contingent liabilities [axis]
標準ラベル（日）: 偶発負債の種類 [軸]
定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Contingent liabilities [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Contingent liabilities [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 偶発負債 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for possible obligations that arise from past events and whose existence will be confirmed only by the occurrence or non-occurrence of one or more uncertain future events not wholly within the control of the entity; or, present obligations that arise from past events but are not recognised because (a) it is probable that an outflow of resources embodying economic benefits will be required to settle the obligations; or (b) the amount of the obligations cannot be measured with sufficient reliability. It also represents the standard value for the 'Classes of contingent liabilities' axis if no other member is used.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Warranty contingent liability [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Warranty contingent liability [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 製品保証に係る偶発負債 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a contingent liability for estimated costs of making good under warranties for products sold. [Refer: Contingent liabilities [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Restructuring contingent liability [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Restructuring contingent liability [member]
標準ラベル（日）: リストラクチャリングに係る偶発負債 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a contingent liability for restructuring, such as the sale or termination of a line of business; closure of business locations in a country or region or relocation of activities from one country or region to another; changes in management structure; and fundamental reorganisations that have a material effect on the nature and focus of the entity's operations. [Refer: Contingent liabilities [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Legal proceedings contingent liability [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Legal proceedings contingent liability [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 訴訟に係る偶発負債 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a contingent liability for legal proceedings. [Refer: Contingent liabilities [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Onerous contracts contingent liability [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Onerous contracts contingent liability [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 不利な契約に係る偶発負債 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a contingent liability for onerous contracts. An onerous contract is a contract in which the unavoidable costs of meeting the obligation under the contract exceed the economic benefits expected to be received under it. [Refer: Contingent liabilities [member]]

定義: This member stands for an environment-related contingent liability that the entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. [Refer: Contingent liabilities [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Reportable segments [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Reportable segments [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 報告セグメント [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for operating segments for which IFRS 8 requires information to be disclosed. The entity shall report separately information about an operating segment that meets any of the following quantitative thresholds: (a) reported revenue, including both sales to external customers and intersegment sales or transfers, is 10 per cent or more of the combined revenue, internal and external, of all operating segments; (b) the absolute amount of its reported profit or loss is 10 per cent or more of the greater, in absolute amount, of (i) the combined reported profit of all operating segments that did not report a loss and (ii) the combined reported loss of all operating segments that reported a loss; or (c) assets are 10 per cent or more of the combined assets of all operating segments. Additionally operating segments that do not meet any of the quantitative thresholds may be considered reportable, and separately disclosed, if management believes that information about the segment would be useful to users of the financial statements. [Refer: Operating segments [member]]

[Refer: Increase (decrease) through cumulative catch-up adjustments to revenue, contract assets]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Performance obligations [axis]
標準ラベル（英）: Performance obligations [axis]
標準ラベル（日）: 履行義務 [軸]
定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Performance obligations [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Performance obligations [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 履行義務 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for all performance obligations. A performance obligation is a promise in a contract with a customer to transfer to the customer either: (a) a good or service (or a bundle of goods or services) that is distinct; or (b) a series of distinct goods or services that are substantially the same and that have the same pattern of transfer to the customer. This member also represents the standard value for the 'Performance obligations' axis if no other member is used.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Performance obligations satisfied over time [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Performance obligations satisfied over time [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 一定の期間にわたり充足される履行義務 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for performance obligations satisfied over time. An entity satisfies a performance obligation over time, if one of the following criteria is met: (a) the customer simultaneously receives and consumes the benefits provided by the entity’s performance as the entity performs; (b) the entity’s performance creates or enhances an asset (for example, work in progress) that the customer controls as the asset is created or enhanced; or (c) the entity’s performance does not create an asset with an alternative use to the entity and the entity has an enforceable right to payment for performance completed to date. [Refer: Performance obligations [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Performance obligations satisfied at point in time [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Performance obligations satisfied at point in time [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 一時点で充足される履行義務 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for performance obligations satisfied at a point in time. An entity satisfies a performance obligation at a point in time, if the performance obligation is not satisfied over time. [Refer: Performance obligations [member]]

標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of performance obligations [line items]
標準ラベル（日）: 履行義務の開示 [表示項目]
定義: Line items represent concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes of the table.

定義: This member stands for a category of assets recognised from the costs to obtain or fulfil contracts with customers representing the pre-contract costs. [Refer: Assets recognised from costs to obtain or fulfil contracts with customers]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Setup costs [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Setup costs [member]
標準ラベル（日）: セットアップ・コスト [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a category of assets recognised from the costs to obtain or fulfil contracts with customers representing the setup costs. [Refer: Assets recognised from costs to obtain or fulfil contracts with customers]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of assets recognised from costs to obtain or fulfil contracts with customers [line items]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of assets recognised from costs to obtain or fulfil contracts with customers [line items]
標準ラベル（日）: 顧客との契約を獲得又は履行するためのコストから認識した資産の開示 [表示項目]
定義: Line items represent concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes of the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Assets recognised from costs to obtain or fulfil contracts with customers
標準ラベル（英）: Assets recognised from costs to obtain or fulfil contracts with customers
標準ラベル（日）: 顧客との契約の獲得又は履行のためのコストから認識した資産
定義: The amount of assets recognised from the costs to obtain or fulfil contracts with customers. The costs to obtain a contract with a customer are the incremental costs of obtaining the contract that the entity would not have incurred if the contract had not been obtained. The costs to fulfil a contract with a customer are the costs that relate directly to a contract or to an anticipated contract that the entity can specifically identify.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Amortisation, assets recognised from costs incurred to obtain or fulfil contracts with customers
標準ラベル（英）: Amortisation, assets recognised from costs incurred to obtain or fulfil contracts with customers
標準ラベル（日）: 償却：顧客との契約の獲得又は履行のためのコストから認識した資産
定義: The amount of amortisation for assets recognised from the costs incurred to obtain or fulfil contracts with customers. [Refer: Assets recognised from costs to obtain or fulfil contracts with customers; Amortisation expense]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Impairment loss, assets recognised from costs incurred to obtain or fulfil contracts with customers
標準ラベル（英）: Impairment loss, assets recognised from costs incurred to obtain or fulfil contracts with customers
標準ラベル（日）: 減損損失：顧客との契約を獲得又は履行するために生じたコストから認識した資産
定義: The amount of impairment loss for assets recognised from the costs incurred to obtain or fulfil contracts with customers. [Refer: Assets recognised from costs to obtain or fulfil contracts with customers; Impairment loss]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Statement that practical expedient about existence of significant financing component has been used
標準ラベル（英）: Statement that practical expedient about existence of significant financing component has been used
標準ラベル（日）: 重大な金融要素の存在に関する実務上の便法を使用した旨の記載
定義: The statement that the practical expedient about the existence of a significant financing component in a contract with a customer has been used.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Statement that practical expedient about incremental costs of obtaining contract has been used
標準ラベル（英）: Statement that practical expedient about incremental costs of obtaining contract has been used
標準ラベル（日）: 契約獲得の増分コストに関する実務上の便法を使用した旨の記載
定義: The statement that the practical expedient about the incremental costs of obtaining a contract with a customer has been used.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of practical expedients used when applying IFRS 15 retrospectively
標準ラベル（英）: Description of practical expedients used when applying IFRS 15 retrospectively
標準ラベル（日）: IFRS第15号を遡及適用する際に用いた実務上の便法の記述
定義: The description of the practical expedients that have been used when applying IFRS 15 retrospectively.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Qualitative assessment of estimated effect of practical expedients used when applying IFRS 15 retrospectively
標準ラベル（英）: Qualitative assessment of estimated effect of practical expedients used when applying IFRS 15 retrospectively
標準ラベル（日）: IFRS第15号を遡及適用した際に用いた実務上の便法の影響の見積りの定性的評価
定義: The qualitative assessment of the estimated effect of the practical expedients used when applying IFRS 15 retrospectively.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Explanation of reasons for significant changes in financial statement line items due to application of IFRS 15
標準ラベル（英）: Explanation of reasons for significant changes in financial statement line items due to application of IFRS 15
標準ラベル（日）: IFRS第15号の適用による財務諸表の表示項目の著しい変動の理由の説明
定義: The explanation of the reasons for significant changes in financial statement line items due to the application of IFRS 15.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of government grants [text block]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of government grants [text block]
標準ラベル（日）: 政府補助金の開示 [テキストブロック]
定義: The entire disclosure for government grants.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of accounting policy for government grants [text block]
標準ラベル（英）: Description of accounting policy for government grants [text block]
標準ラベル（日）: 政府補助金についての会計方針の記述 [テキストブロック]
定義: The description of the entity's accounting policy for government grants, including the methods of presentation adopted in the financial statements. [Refer: Government [member]; Government grants]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of nature and extent of government grants recognised in financial statements
標準ラベル（英）: Description of nature and extent of government grants recognised in financial statements
標準ラベル（日）: 財務諸表に認識した政府補助金の内容及び範囲の記述
定義: The description of the nature and extent of government grants recognised in the financial statements. [Refer: Government grants]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Income from government grants
標準ラベル（英）: Income from government grants
標準ラベル（日）: 政府補助金による収益
定義: The amount of income recognised in relation to government grants. [Refer: Government grants]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Indication of other forms of government assistance with direct benefits for entity
標準ラベル（英）: Indication of other forms of government assistance with direct benefits for entity
標準ラベル（日）: 他の形態の政府援助で企業が直接便益を受けたものの記載
定義: The description of an indication of forms of government assistance from which the entity has directly benefited, other than government grants recognised in the financial statements. [Refer: Government grants]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Explanation of unfulfilled conditions and other contingencies attaching to government assistance
標準ラベル（英）: Explanation of unfulfilled conditions and other contingencies attaching to government assistance
標準ラベル（日）: 政府援助に付随する未履行の条件及びその他の偶発事象の説明
定義: The explanation of unfulfilled conditions and other contingencies attaching to government assistance that has been recognised. [Refer: Government [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of recognised revenue from construction contracts [text block]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of recognised revenue from construction contracts [text block]
標準ラベル（日）: 工事契約により認識した収益の開示 [テキストブロック]
定義: The entire disclosure for revenue recognised from construction contracts.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Revenue from construction contracts
標準ラベル（英）: Revenue from construction contracts
標準ラベル（日）: 工事契約による収益
定義: The amount of revenue arising from construction contracts. Construction contracts are contracts specifically negotiated for the construction of an asset or a combination of assets that are closely interrelated or interdependent in terms of their design, technology and function or their ultimate purpose or use. [Refer: Revenue]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Methods used to determine construction contract revenue recognised
標準ラベル（英）: Methods used to determine construction contract revenue recognised
標準ラベル（日）: 認識した工事契約収益を算定するために用いた方法
定義: The description of the methods used by the entity to determine the construction contract revenue recognised in the period. [Refer: Revenue from construction contracts]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Methods used to determine stage of completion of construction in progress
標準ラベル（英）: Methods used to determine stage of completion of construction in progress
標準ラベル（日）: 進行中の工事契約の進捗度を決定するために用いた方法
定義: The description of the methods used by the entity to determine the stage of completion of construction contracts in progress.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Costs incurred and recognised profits (less recognised losses)
標準ラベル（英）: Costs incurred and recognised profits (less recognised losses)
標準ラベル（日）: 発生した原価及び認識した利益（認識した損失を控除後）
定義: The aggregate amount of costs incurred and recognised profits, less recognised losses, to date on construction contracts in progress.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Advances received for contracts in progress
標準ラベル（英）: Advances received for contracts in progress
標準ラベル（日）: 未成工事に係る前受金
定義: The amount of advances received by the entity before the related work is performed on construction contracts.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Retention for contracts in progress
標準ラベル（英）: Retention for contracts in progress
標準ラベル（日）: 未成工事に係る保留金
定義: The amount of progress billings on construction contracts that are not paid until the conditions specified in the contract for the payment of such amounts have been satisfied or until defects have been rectified. [Refer: Progress billings]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Gross amount due from customers for contract work as asset
標準ラベル（英）: Gross amount due from customers for contract work as asset
標準ラベル（日）: 契約に基づく工事の発注者に対する債権総額
定義: The amount recognised as an asset as the net of: (a) costs incurred plus recognised profits; less (b) the sum of recognised losses and progress billings for all contracts in progress for which costs incurred plus recognised profits (less recognised losses) exceeds progress billings.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Gross amount due to customers for contract work as liability
標準ラベル（英）: Gross amount due to customers for contract work as liability
標準ラベル（日）: 契約に基づく工事の発注者に対する債務総額
定義: The amount recognised as a liability as the net of: (a) costs incurred plus recognised profits; less (b) the sum of recognised losses and progress billings for all contracts in progress for which progress billings exceed costs incurred plus recognised profits (less recognised losses).

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Progress billings
標準ラベル（英）: Progress billings
標準ラベル（日）: 中間請求
定義: The amounts billed for work performed on a construction contract whether or not they have been paid by the customer.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of impairment of assets [text block]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of impairment of assets [text block]
標準ラベル（日）: 資産の減損の開示 [テキストブロック]
定義: The entire disclosure for the impairment of assets.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of impairment loss and reversal of impairment loss [text block]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of impairment loss and reversal of impairment loss [text block]
標準ラベル（日）: 減損損失及び減損損失の戻入れの開示 [テキストブロック]
定義: The disclosure of impairment loss and the reversal of impairment loss. [Refer: Impairment loss; Reversal of impairment loss]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of impairment loss and reversal of impairment loss [abstract]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of impairment loss and reversal of impairment loss [abstract]
標準ラベル（日）: 減損損失及び減損損失の戻入れの開示 [タイトル項目]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of impairment loss and reversal of impairment loss [table]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of impairment loss and reversal of impairment loss [table]
標準ラベル（日）: 減損損失及び減損損失の戻入れの開示 [表]
定義: Schedule disclosing information related to impairment loss and the reversal of impairment loss.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Classes of assets [axis]
標準ラベル（英）: Classes of assets [axis]
標準ラベル（日）: 資産の種類 [軸]
定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Assets [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Assets [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 資産 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for resources: (a) controlled by an entity as a result of past events; and (b) from which future economic benefits are expected to flow to the entity. It also represents the standard value for the 'Classes of assets' axis if no other member is used.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Property, plant and equipment [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Property, plant and equipment [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 有形固定資産 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for property, plant and equipment. It also represents the standard value for the 'Classes of property, plant and equipment' axis if no other member is used. [Refer: Property, plant and equipment]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Intangible assets other than goodwill [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Intangible assets other than goodwill [member]
標準ラベル（日）: のれん以外の無形資産 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for intangible assets other than goodwill. It also represents the standard value for the 'Classes of intangible assets other than goodwill' axis if no other member is used. [Refer: Intangible assets other than goodwill]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Right-of-use assets [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Right-of-use assets [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 使用権資産 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for right-of-use assets. [Refer: Right-of-use assets]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Exploration and evaluation assets [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Exploration and evaluation assets [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 探査及び評価資産 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for exploration and evaluation expenditures recognised as assets in accordance with the entity's accounting policy. Exploration and evaluation expenditures are expenditures incurred by an entity in connection with the exploration for, and evaluation of, mineral resources before the technical feasibility and commercial viability of extracting a mineral resource are demonstrable.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Goodwill [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Goodwill [member]
標準ラベル（日）: のれん [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for goodwill. [Refer: Goodwill]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Investments accounted for using equity method [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Investments accounted for using equity method [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 持分法で会計処理している投資 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for investments accounted for using the equity method. [Refer: Investments accounted for using equity method]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Non-current assets or disposal groups classified as held for sale [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Non-current assets or disposal groups classified as held for sale [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 売却目的保有に分類された非流動資産又は処分グループ [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for non-current assets or disposal groups classified as held for sale. [Refer: Disposal groups classified as held for sale [member]; Non-current assets held for sale [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Other impaired assets [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Other impaired assets [member]
標準ラベル（日）: その他の減損した資産 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for impaired assets that the entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of impairment loss and reversal of impairment loss [line items]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of impairment loss and reversal of impairment loss [line items]
標準ラベル（日）: 減損損失及び減損損失の戻入れの開示 [表示項目]
定義: Line items represent concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes of the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Impairment loss recognised in profit or loss
標準ラベル（英）: Impairment loss recognised in profit or loss
標準ラベル（日）: 純損益に認識した減損損失
定義: The amount of impairment loss recognised in profit or loss. [Refer: Impairment loss; Profit (loss)]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of line item(s) in statement of comprehensive income in which impairment losses recognised in profit or loss are included
標準ラベル（英）: Description of line item(s) in statement of comprehensive income in which impairment losses recognised in profit or loss are included
標準ラベル（日）: 純損益に認識した減損損失を含んでいる包括利益計算書上の表示科目の記述
定義: The description of line item(s) of the statement of comprehensive income in which impairment losses recognised in profit or loss are included. [Refer: Impairment loss (reversal of impairment loss) recognised in profit or loss]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Reversal of impairment loss recognised in profit or loss
標準ラベル（英）: Reversal of impairment loss recognised in profit or loss
標準ラベル（日）: 純損益に認識した減損損失の戻入れ
定義: The amount of reversal of impairment loss recognised in profit or loss. [Refer: Reversal of impairment loss; Profit (loss)]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of line item(s) in statement of comprehensive income in which impairment losses recognised in profit or loss are reversed
標準ラベル（英）: Description of line item(s) in statement of comprehensive income in which impairment losses recognised in profit or loss are reversed
標準ラベル（日）: 純損益に認識した減損損失の戻入れを含んでいる包括利益計算書上の表示科目の記述
定義: The description of line item(s) of the statement of comprehensive income in which impairment losses recognised in profit or loss are reversed. [Refer: Impairment loss (reversal of impairment loss) recognised in profit or loss]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Impairment loss recognised in other comprehensive income
標準ラベル（英）: Impairment loss recognised in other comprehensive income
標準ラベル（日）: その他の包括利益に認識した減損損失
定義: The amount of impairment loss recognised in other comprehensive income. Impairment loss on a revalued asset is recognised in other comprehensive income to the extent that the impairment loss does not exceed the amount in the revaluation surplus for that same asset. [Refer: Impairment loss; Revaluation surplus; Other comprehensive income]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Reversal of impairment loss recognised in other comprehensive income
標準ラベル（英）: Reversal of impairment loss recognised in other comprehensive income
標準ラベル（日）: その他の包括利益に認識した減損損失の戻入れ
定義: The amount of reversal of impairment loss recognised in other comprehensive income. [Refer: Reversal of impairment loss; Impairment loss recognised in other comprehensive income]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of information for impairment loss recognised or reversed for individual asset or cash-generating unit [text block]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of information for impairment loss recognised or reversed for individual asset or cash-generating unit [text block]
標準ラベル（日）: 個別資産又は資金生成単位について認識又は戻入れをした減損損失に係る情報の開示 [テキストブロック]
定義: The disclosure of information for an individual asset, including goodwill, or a cash-generating unit, for which an impairment loss has been recognised or reversed. [Refer: Goodwill; Impairment loss; Reversal of impairment loss; Cash-generating units [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of information for impairment loss recognised or reversed for individual asset or cash-generating unit [abstract]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of information for impairment loss recognised or reversed for individual asset or cash-generating unit [abstract]
標準ラベル（日）: 個別資産又は資金生成単位について認識又は戻入れをした減損損失に係る情報の開示 [タイトル項目]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of information for impairment loss recognised or reversed for individual asset or cash-generating unit [table]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of information for impairment loss recognised or reversed for individual asset or cash-generating unit [table]
標準ラベル（日）: 個別資産又は資金生成単位について認識又は戻入れをした減損損失に係る情報の開示 [表]
定義: Schedule disclosing information related to an individual asset or a cash-generating unit, for which an impairment loss has been recognised or reversed.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Individual assets or cash-generating units [axis]
標準ラベル（英）: Individual assets or cash-generating units [axis]
標準ラベル（日）: 個別の資産又は資金生成単位 [軸]
定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Entity's total for individual assets or cash-generating units [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Entity's total for individual assets or cash-generating units [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 個別の資産又は資金生成単位についての企業全体の合計 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for the standard value for the 'Individual assets or cash-generating units' axis if no other member is used.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Individual assets or cash-generating units [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Individual assets or cash-generating units [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 個別の資産又は資金生成単位 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for individual assets or cash-generating units. [Refer: Cash-generating units [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of information for impairment loss recognised or reversed for individual asset or cash-generating unit [line items]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of information for impairment loss recognised or reversed for individual asset or cash-generating unit [line items]
標準ラベル（日）: 個別資産又は資金生成単位について認識又は戻入れをした減損損失に係る情報の開示 [表示項目]
定義: Line items represent concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes of the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Explanation of main events and circumstances that led to recognition of impairment losses and reversals of impairment losses
標準ラベル（英）: Explanation of main events and circumstances that led to recognition of impairment losses and reversals of impairment losses
標準ラベル（日）: 減損損失の認識及び減損損失の戻入れに至った事象及び状況の説明
定義: The explanation of the main events and circumstances that led to the recognition of impairment losses and reversals of impairment losses. [Refer: Impairment loss]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Impairment loss
標準ラベル（英）: Impairment loss
標準ラベル（日）: 減損損失
定義: The amount recognised as a reduction of the carrying amount of an asset or cash-generating unit to its recoverable amount. [Refer: Carrying amount [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Reversal of impairment loss
標準ラベル（英）: Reversal of impairment loss
標準ラベル（日）: 減損損失の戻入れ
定義: The amount recognised as an increase of the carrying amount of an asset or cash-generating unit to its recoverable amount when an impairment loss had been previously recognised. [Refer: Impairment loss]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of nature of individual asset
標準ラベル（英）: Description of nature of individual asset
標準ラベル（日）: 個別の資産の性質の記述
定義: The description of the nature of an individual asset for which material impairment loss is recognised or reversed during the period. [Refer: Impairment loss]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of reportable segment to which individual asset belongs
標準ラベル（英）: Description of reportable segment to which individual asset belongs
標準ラベル（日）: 個々の資産が属する報告セグメントの記述
定義: The description of the reportable segment to which an individual asset belongs. [Refer: Impairment loss]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of cash-generating unit
標準ラベル（英）: Description of cash-generating unit
標準ラベル（日）: 資金生成単位の記述
定義: The description of a cash-generating unit (such as whether it is a product line, a plant, a business operation, a geographical area or a reportable segment as defined in IFRS 8). [Refer: Cash-generating units [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of current and former way of aggregating assets
標準ラベル（英）: Description of current and former way of aggregating assets
標準ラベル（日）: 資産の現在及び従来の集約方法の記述
定義: The description of the current and former way of aggregating assets for cash-generating units if the aggregation of assets for identifying the cash-generating unit has changed since the previous estimate of the cash-generating unit’s recoverable amount (if any). [Refer: Cash-generating units [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of reasons for changing way cash-generating unit is identified
標準ラベル（英）: Description of reasons for changing way cash-generating unit is identified
標準ラベル（日）: 資金生成単位の識別方法の変更理由の記述
定義: The description of the reasons for changing the way a cash-generating unit is identified if the aggregation of assets for identifying the cash-generating unit has changed since the previous estimate of the cash-generating unit’s recoverable amount (if any). [Refer: Cash-generating units [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Recoverable amount of asset or cash-generating unit
標準ラベル（英）: Recoverable amount of asset or cash-generating unit
標準ラベル（日）: 資産又は資金生成単位の回収可能価額
定義: The higher of an asset’s (or cash-generating unit’s) fair value less costs of disposal and its value in use. [Refer: Cash-generating units [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Information whether recoverable amount of asset is fair value less costs of disposal or value in use
標準ラベル（英）: Information whether recoverable amount of asset is fair value less costs of disposal or value in use
標準ラベル（日）: 資産の回収可能価額が処分コスト控除後の公正価値なのか使用価値なのかに関する情報
定義: Information about whether the recoverable amount of an asset (cash-generating unit) is its fair value less costs of disposal or its value in use. [Refer: Cash-generating units [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of level of fair value hierarchy within which fair value measurement is categorised
標準ラベル（英）: Description of level of fair value hierarchy within which fair value measurement is categorised
標準ラベル（日）: 公正価値測定が区分される公正価値ヒエラルキーのレベルの記述
定義: The description of the level of the fair value hierarchy within which the fair value measurement is categorised in its entirety (without giving regard to the observability of 'costs of disposal') for a cash-generating unit (group of units'). [Refer: Cash-generating units [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of valuation techniques used to measure fair value less costs of disposal
標準ラベル（英）: Description of valuation techniques used to measure fair value less costs of disposal
標準ラベル（日）: 処分コスト控除後の公正価値の測定に用いた評価技法の記述
定義: The description of the valuation techniques used to measure fair value less costs of disposal for a cash generating unit (group of units). [Refer: Valuation techniques [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of change in valuation technique used to measure fair value less costs of disposal
標準ラベル（英）: Description of change in valuation technique used to measure fair value less costs of disposal
標準ラベル（日）: 処分コスト控除後の公正価値の測定に用いた評価技法の変更の記述
定義: The description of a change in valuation technique used to measure fair value less costs of disposal. [Refer: Valuation techniques [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of reasons for change in valuation technique used to measure fair value less costs of disposal
標準ラベル（英）: Description of reasons for change in valuation technique used to measure fair value less costs of disposal
標準ラベル（日）: 処分コスト控除後の公正価値の測定に用いた評価技法の変更の理由の記述
定義: The description of the reasons for a change in valuation technique used to measure fair value less costs of disposal. [Refer: Valuation techniques [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of key assumptions on which management has based determination of fair value less costs of disposal
標準ラベル（英）: Description of key assumptions on which management has based determination of fair value less costs of disposal
標準ラベル（日）: 経営者が処分コスト控除後の公正価値の算定の基礎とした主要な仮定の記述
定義: The description of key assumptions on which management has based its determination of fair value less costs of disposal for a cash-generating unit (group of units). Key assumptions are those to which the unit's (group of units') recoverable amount is most sensitive. [Refer: Cash-generating units [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Discount rate used in current measurement of fair value less costs of disposal
標準ラベル（英）: Discount rate used in current measurement of fair value less costs of disposal
標準ラベル（日）: 処分コスト控除後の公正価値の現在の測定に使用した割引率
定義: The discount rate used in the current measurement of fair value less costs of disposal.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Discount rate used in previous measurement of fair value less costs of disposal
標準ラベル（英）: Discount rate used in previous measurement of fair value less costs of disposal
標準ラベル（日）: 処分コスト控除後の公正価値の過去の測定に使用した割引率
定義: The discount rate used in the previous measurement of fair value less costs of disposal.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Discount rate used in current estimate of value in use
標準ラベル（英）: Discount rate used in current estimate of value in use
標準ラベル（日）: 使用価値の現在の見積りに使用した割引率
定義: The discount rate used in the current estimate of the present value of the future cash flows expected to be derived from an asset or cash-generating unit.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Discount rate used in previous estimate of value in use
標準ラベル（英）: Discount rate used in previous estimate of value in use
標準ラベル（日）: 使用価値の過去の見積りに使用した割引率
定義: The discount rate used in the previous estimate of the present value of the future cash flows expected to be derived from an asset or cash-generating unit.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Explanation of impairment loss recognised or reversed [text block]
標準ラベル（英）: Explanation of impairment loss recognised or reversed [text block]
標準ラベル（日）: 認識又は戻入れをした減損損失の説明 [テキストブロック]
定義: The disclosure of an impairment loss recognised or reversed. [Refer: Impairment loss; Reversal of impairment loss]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of impairment loss recognised or reversed [abstract]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of impairment loss recognised or reversed [abstract]
標準ラベル（日）: 認識又は戻入れをした減損損失の開示 [タイトル項目]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of impairment loss recognised or reversed [table]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of impairment loss recognised or reversed [table]
標準ラベル（日）: 認識又は戻入れをした減損損失の開示 [表]
定義: Schedule disclosing information related to impairment loss recognised or reversed for a cash-generating unit.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Individual assets or cash-generating units [axis]
標準ラベル（英）: Individual assets or cash-generating units [axis]
標準ラベル（日）: 個別の資産又は資金生成単位 [軸]
定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Entity's total for individual assets or cash-generating units [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Entity's total for individual assets or cash-generating units [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 個別の資産又は資金生成単位についての企業全体の合計 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for the standard value for the 'Individual assets or cash-generating units' axis if no other member is used.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Individual assets or cash-generating units [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Individual assets or cash-generating units [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 個別の資産又は資金生成単位 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for individual assets or cash-generating units. [Refer: Cash-generating units [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Classes of assets [axis]
標準ラベル（英）: Classes of assets [axis]
標準ラベル（日）: 資産の種類 [軸]
定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Assets [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Assets [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 資産 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for resources: (a) controlled by an entity as a result of past events; and (b) from which future economic benefits are expected to flow to the entity. It also represents the standard value for the 'Classes of assets' axis if no other member is used.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Property, plant and equipment [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Property, plant and equipment [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 有形固定資産 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for property, plant and equipment. It also represents the standard value for the 'Classes of property, plant and equipment' axis if no other member is used. [Refer: Property, plant and equipment]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Intangible assets other than goodwill [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Intangible assets other than goodwill [member]
標準ラベル（日）: のれん以外の無形資産 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for intangible assets other than goodwill. It also represents the standard value for the 'Classes of intangible assets other than goodwill' axis if no other member is used. [Refer: Intangible assets other than goodwill]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Right-of-use assets [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Right-of-use assets [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 使用権資産 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for right-of-use assets. [Refer: Right-of-use assets]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Exploration and evaluation assets [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Exploration and evaluation assets [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 探査及び評価資産 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for exploration and evaluation expenditures recognised as assets in accordance with the entity's accounting policy. Exploration and evaluation expenditures are expenditures incurred by an entity in connection with the exploration for, and evaluation of, mineral resources before the technical feasibility and commercial viability of extracting a mineral resource are demonstrable.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Goodwill [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Goodwill [member]
標準ラベル（日）: のれん [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for goodwill. [Refer: Goodwill]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Investments accounted for using equity method [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Investments accounted for using equity method [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 持分法で会計処理している投資 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for investments accounted for using the equity method. [Refer: Investments accounted for using equity method]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Non-current assets or disposal groups classified as held for sale [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Non-current assets or disposal groups classified as held for sale [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 売却目的保有に分類された非流動資産又は処分グループ [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for non-current assets or disposal groups classified as held for sale. [Refer: Disposal groups classified as held for sale [member]; Non-current assets held for sale [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Other impaired assets [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Other impaired assets [member]
標準ラベル（日）: その他の減損した資産 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for impaired assets that the entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Segments [axis]
標準ラベル（英）: Segments [axis]
標準ラベル（日）: セグメント [軸]
定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Segments [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Segments [member]
標準ラベル（日）: セグメント [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for all segments of an entity. It also represents the standard value for the 'Segments' axis if no other member is used.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Reportable segments [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Reportable segments [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 報告セグメント [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for operating segments for which IFRS 8 requires information to be disclosed. The entity shall report separately information about an operating segment that meets any of the following quantitative thresholds: (a) reported revenue, including both sales to external customers and intersegment sales or transfers, is 10 per cent or more of the combined revenue, internal and external, of all operating segments; (b) the absolute amount of its reported profit or loss is 10 per cent or more of the greater, in absolute amount, of (i) the combined reported profit of all operating segments that did not report a loss and (ii) the combined reported loss of all operating segments that reported a loss; or (c) assets are 10 per cent or more of the combined assets of all operating segments. Additionally operating segments that do not meet any of the quantitative thresholds may be considered reportable, and separately disclosed, if management believes that information about the segment would be useful to users of the financial statements. [Refer: Operating segments [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of impairment loss recognised or reversed [line items]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of impairment loss recognised or reversed [line items]
標準ラベル（日）: 認識又は戻入れをした減損損失の開示 [表示項目]
定義: Line items represent concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes of the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Impairment loss
標準ラベル（英）: Impairment loss
標準ラベル（日）: 減損損失
定義: The amount recognised as a reduction of the carrying amount of an asset or cash-generating unit to its recoverable amount. [Refer: Carrying amount [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Reversal of impairment loss
標準ラベル（英）: Reversal of impairment loss
標準ラベル（日）: 減損損失の戻入れ
定義: The amount recognised as an increase of the carrying amount of an asset or cash-generating unit to its recoverable amount when an impairment loss had been previously recognised. [Refer: Impairment loss]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Explanation of main events and circumstances that led to recognition of impairment losses and reversals of impairment losses
標準ラベル（英）: Explanation of main events and circumstances that led to recognition of impairment losses and reversals of impairment losses
標準ラベル（日）: 減損損失の認識及び減損損失の戻入れに至った事象及び状況の説明
定義: The explanation of the main events and circumstances that led to the recognition of impairment losses and reversals of impairment losses. [Refer: Impairment loss]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Explanation of main classes of assets affected by impairment losses or reversals of impairment losses
標準ラベル（英）: Explanation of main classes of assets affected by impairment losses or reversals of impairment losses
標準ラベル（日）: 減損損失又は減損損失の戻入れの影響を受ける主な資産の種類の説明
定義: The explanation of the main classes of assets affected by impairment losses or reversals of impairment losses. [Refer: Impairment loss]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Unallocated goodwill
標準ラベル（英）: Unallocated goodwill
標準ラベル（日）: 配分していないのれん
定義: The amount of goodwill acquired in a business combination that has not been allocated to a cash-generating unit (group of units). [Refer: Goodwill; Cash-generating units [member]; Business combinations [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Explanation of goodwill not allocated to cash-generating unit
標準ラベル（英）: Explanation of goodwill not allocated to cash-generating unit
標準ラベル（日）: 資金生成単位に配分していないのれんの説明
定義: The explanation of the reasons why a portion of the goodwill acquired in a business combination has not been allocated to a cash-generating unit (group of units). [Refer: Goodwill; Cash-generating units [member]; Business combinations [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Explanation of fact that carrying amount of goodwill or intangible assets with indefinite useful lives is not significant
標準ラベル（英）: Explanation of fact that carrying amount of goodwill or intangible assets with indefinite useful lives is not significant
標準ラベル（日）: のれん又は耐用年数を確定できない無形資産の帳簿価額が重要でない旨の説明
定義: The explanation of the fact that the carrying amount of goodwill or intangible assets with indefinite useful lives allocated to a unit (group of units) across multiple cash-generating units (groups of units) is not significant in comparison with the entity's total carrying amount of goodwill or intangible assets with indefinite useful lives. [Refer: Carrying amount [member]; Cash-generating units [member]; Intangible assets other than goodwill]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Explanation of fact that aggregate carrying amount of goodwill or intangible assets with indefinite useful lives allocated to cash-generating units is significant
標準ラベル（英）: Explanation of fact that aggregate carrying amount of goodwill or intangible assets with indefinite useful lives allocated to cash-generating units is significant
標準ラベル（日）: 資金生成単位に配分されたのれん又は耐用年数を確定できない無形資産の帳簿価額の合計が重要である旨の説明
定義: The explanation of the fact that the aggregate carrying amount of goodwill or intangible assets with indefinite useful lives allocated to the cash-generating unit (group of units) is significant in comparison with the entity's total carrying amount of goodwill or intangible assets with indefinite useful lives. [Refer: Carrying amount [member]; Cash-generating units [member]; Intangible assets other than goodwill]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of information for cash-generating units [text block]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of information for cash-generating units [text block]
標準ラベル（日）: 資金生成単位に関する情報の開示 [テキストブロック]
定義: The disclosure of information for cash-generating units. [Refer: Cash-generating units [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of information for cash-generating units [abstract]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of information for cash-generating units [abstract]
標準ラベル（日）: 資金生成単位に関する情報の開示 [タイトル項目]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of information for cash-generating units [table]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of information for cash-generating units [table]
標準ラベル（日）: 資金生成単位に関する情報の開示 [表]
定義: Schedule disclosing information related to cash-generating units.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Cash-generating units [axis]
標準ラベル（英）: Cash-generating units [axis]
標準ラベル（日）: 資金生成単位 [軸]
定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Entity's total for cash-generating units [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Entity's total for cash-generating units [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 資金生成単位についての企業全体の合計 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for the standard value for the 'Cash-generating units' axis if no other member is used.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Cash-generating units [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Cash-generating units [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 資金生成単位 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for the smallest identifiable group of assets that generates cash inflows that are largely independent of the cash inflows from other assets or groups of assets.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Aggregate cash-generating units for which amount of goodwill or intangible assets with indefinite useful lives is not significant [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Aggregate cash-generating units for which amount of goodwill or intangible assets with indefinite useful lives is not significant [member]
標準ラベル（日）: のれん又は耐用年数を確定できない無形資産の金額が重要でない資金生成単位の合計 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for the aggregate of cash-generating units for which the amount of goodwill or intangible assets with indefinite useful lives is not significant. [Refer: Cash-generating units [member]; Goodwill; Intangible assets other than goodwill]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of information for cash-generating units [line items]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of information for cash-generating units [line items]
標準ラベル（日）: 資金生成単位に関する情報の開示 [表示項目]
定義: Line items represent concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes of the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Goodwill
標準ラベル（英）: Goodwill
標準ラベル（日）: のれん
定義: The amount of assets representing the future economic benefits arising from other assets acquired in a business combination that are not individually identified and separately recognised. [Refer: Business combinations [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Intangible assets with indefinite useful life
標準ラベル（英）: Intangible assets with indefinite useful life
標準ラベル（日）: 耐用年数を確定できない無形資産
定義: The amount of intangible assets assessed as having an indefinite useful life. [Refer: Intangible assets other than goodwill]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of basis on which unit's recoverable amount has been determined
標準ラベル（英）: Description of basis on which unit's recoverable amount has been determined
標準ラベル（日）: 資金生成単位の回収可能価額の算定基礎の記述
定義: The description of the basis on which the cash-generating unit's (group of units') recoverable amount has been determined (ie value in use or fair value less costs of disposal). [Refer: Cash-generating units [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of key assumptions on which management has based cash flow projections
標準ラベル（英）: Description of key assumptions on which management has based cash flow projections
標準ラベル（日）: 経営者がキャッシュ・フロー予測の基礎とした主要な仮定の記述
定義: The description of key assumptions on which management has based its cash flow projections for the period covered by the most recent budgets/forecasts for a cash-generating unit (group of units). Key assumptions are those to which the unit's (group of units') recoverable amount is most sensitive. [Refer: Cash-generating units [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of valuation techniques used to measure fair value less costs of disposal
標準ラベル（英）: Description of valuation techniques used to measure fair value less costs of disposal
標準ラベル（日）: 処分コスト控除後の公正価値の測定に用いた評価技法の記述
定義: The description of the valuation techniques used to measure fair value less costs of disposal for a cash generating unit (group of units). [Refer: Valuation techniques [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of key assumptions on which management has based determination of fair value less costs of disposal
標準ラベル（英）: Description of key assumptions on which management has based determination of fair value less costs of disposal
標準ラベル（日）: 経営者が処分コスト控除後の公正価値の算定の基礎とした主要な仮定の記述
定義: The description of key assumptions on which management has based its determination of fair value less costs of disposal for a cash-generating unit (group of units). Key assumptions are those to which the unit's (group of units') recoverable amount is most sensitive. [Refer: Cash-generating units [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of management's approach to determining values assigned to key assumptions
標準ラベル（英）: Description of management's approach to determining values assigned to key assumptions
標準ラベル（日）: 主要な仮定に割り当てた値を算定した経営者の手法の記述
定義: The description of management's approach to determining the value (or values) assigned to key assumptions, whether those value(s) reflect past experience or, if appropriate, are consistent with external sources of information and, if not, how and why they differ from past experience or external sources of information. Key assumptions are those to which the unit’s (group of units’) recoverable amount is most sensitive.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of level of fair value hierarchy within which fair value measurement is categorised
標準ラベル（英）: Description of level of fair value hierarchy within which fair value measurement is categorised
標準ラベル（日）: 公正価値測定が区分される公正価値ヒエラルキーのレベルの記述
定義: The description of the level of the fair value hierarchy within which the fair value measurement is categorised in its entirety (without giving regard to the observability of 'costs of disposal') for a cash-generating unit (group of units'). [Refer: Cash-generating units [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of change in valuation technique used to measure fair value less costs of disposal
標準ラベル（英）: Description of change in valuation technique used to measure fair value less costs of disposal
標準ラベル（日）: 処分コスト控除後の公正価値の測定に用いた評価技法の変更の記述
定義: The description of a change in valuation technique used to measure fair value less costs of disposal. [Refer: Valuation techniques [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of reasons for change in valuation technique used to measure fair value less costs of disposal
標準ラベル（英）: Description of reasons for change in valuation technique used to measure fair value less costs of disposal
標準ラベル（日）: 処分コスト控除後の公正価値の測定に用いた評価技法の変更の理由の記述
定義: The description of the reasons for a change in valuation technique used to measure fair value less costs of disposal. [Refer: Valuation techniques [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Explanation of period over which management has projected cash flows
標準ラベル（英）: Explanation of period over which management has projected cash flows
標準ラベル（日）: 経営者がキャッシュ・フローの予測を行った期間の説明
定義: The explanation of the period over which management has projected cash flows based on financial budgets/forecasts approved by management including, when a period greater than five years is used for a cash-generating unit (group of units), an explanation of why that longer period is justified. [Refer: Cash-generating units [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Growth rate used to extrapolate cash flow projections
標準ラベル（英）: Growth rate used to extrapolate cash flow projections
標準ラベル（日）: キャッシュ・フロー予測の推定に用いた成長率
定義: The growth rate used to extrapolate cash flow projections beyond the period covered by the most recent budgets/forecasts for a cash-generating unit (group of units). [Refer: Cash-generating units [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of justification for using growth rate that exceeds long-term average growth rate
標準ラベル（英）: Description of justification for using growth rate that exceeds long-term average growth rate
標準ラベル（日）: 長期の平均成長率を超えた成長率の使用の正当性の記述
定義: The description of the justification for using any growth rate to extrapolate cash flow projections that exceeds the long-term average growth rate for the products, industries or country (countries) in which the entity operates, or for the market to which a cash-generating unit (group of units) is dedicated. [Refer: Cash-generating units [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Discount rate applied to cash flow projections
標準ラベル（英）: Discount rate applied to cash flow projections
標準ラベル（日）: キャッシュ・フロー予測に適用した割引率
定義: The discount rate applied to cash flow projections for a cash-generating unit (group of units). [Refer: Cash-generating units [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Amount by which unit's recoverable amount exceeds its carrying amount
標準ラベル（英）: Amount by which unit's recoverable amount exceeds its carrying amount
標準ラベル（日）: 資金生成単位の回収可能価額が帳簿価額を上回っている金額
定義: The amount by which a cash-generating unit's (group of units') recoverable amount exceeds its carrying amount. [Refer: Carrying amount [member]; Cash-generating units [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Explanation of value assigned to key assumption
標準ラベル（英）: Explanation of value assigned to key assumption
標準ラベル（日）: 主要な仮定に割り当てた値の説明
定義: The explanation of the value(s) assigned to key assumption(s) on which management has based its determination of recoverable amount for a cash-generating unit (group of units). [Refer: Cash-generating units [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Amount by which value assigned to key assumption must change in order for unit's recoverable amount to be equal to carrying amount
標準ラベル（英）: Amount by which value assigned to key assumption must change in order for unit's recoverable amount to be equal to carrying amount
標準ラベル（日）: 資金生成単位の回収可能価額を帳簿価額と等しくするには、主要な仮定に割り当てた値をどれだけ変化させなければならないか
定義: The amount by which value that has been assigned to a key assumption must change in order for a unit's recoverable amount to be equal to its carrying amount. [Refer: Carrying amount [member]]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of leases [text block]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of leases [text block]
標準ラベル（日）: リースの開示 [テキストブロック]
定義: The entire disclosure for leases.

定義: The disclosure of assets recognised by the entity as a result of engaging in finance leases. [Refer: Recognised finance lease as assets]

標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of recognised finance lease as assets by lessee [abstract]
標準ラベル（日）: 借手が資産として認識したファイナンス・リースの開示 [タイトル項目]

標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of recognised finance lease as assets by lessee [table]

定義: Schedule disclosing information related to assets recognised by the lessee under a finance lease.

標準ラベル（英）: Classes of assets [axis]
標準ラベル（日）: 資産の種類 [軸]
定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Assets [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Assets [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 資産 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for resources: (a) controlled by an entity as a result of past events; and (b) from which future economic benefits are expected to flow to the entity. It also represents the standard value for the 'Classes of assets' axis if no other member is used.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Property, plant and equipment [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Property, plant and equipment [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 有形固定資産 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for property, plant and equipment. It also represents the standard value for the 'Classes of property, plant and equipment' axis if no other member is used. [Refer: Property, plant and equipment]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Intangible assets other than goodwill [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Intangible assets other than goodwill [member]
標準ラベル（日）: のれん以外の無形資産 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for intangible assets other than goodwill. It also represents the standard value for the 'Classes of intangible assets other than goodwill' axis if no other member is used. [Refer: Intangible assets other than goodwill]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Investment property [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Investment property [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 投資不動産 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for investment property. It also represents the standard value for the 'Types of investment property' axis if no other member is used. [Refer: Investment property]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Biological assets [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Biological assets [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 生物資産 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for living animals or plants. It also represents the standard value for the 'Biological assets' axis if no other member is used.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Other assets [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Other assets [member]
標準ラベル（日）: その他の資産 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for assets that the entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Carrying amount, accumulated depreciation, amortisation and impairment and gross carrying amount [axis]
標準ラベル（英）: Carrying amount, accumulated depreciation, amortisation and impairment and gross carrying amount [axis]
標準ラベル（日）: 帳簿価額、減価償却、償却及び減損の累計額、並びに償却累計額控除前の帳簿価額 [軸]
定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Carrying amount [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Carrying amount [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 帳簿価額 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for the amount at which an asset is recognised in the statement of financial position (after deducting any accumulated depreciation or amortisation and accumulated impairment losses). It also represents the standard value for the 'Carrying amount, accumulated depreciation, amortisation and impairment and gross carrying amount' axis if no other member is used. [Refer: Depreciation and amortisation expense; Impairment loss]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Gross carrying amount [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Gross carrying amount [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 減価償却累計額控除前の帳簿価額 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for the amount at which an asset is recognised before deducting any accumulated depreciation (amortisation) and accumulated impairment losses thereon. [Refer: Depreciation and amortisation expense; Impairment loss]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Accumulated depreciation, amortisation and impairment [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Accumulated depreciation, amortisation and impairment [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 減価償却、償却及び減損の累計額 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for accumulated depreciation, amortisation and impairment. [Refer: Impairment loss; Depreciation and amortisation expense]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Accumulated depreciation and amortisation [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Accumulated depreciation and amortisation [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 減価償却及び償却の累計額 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for accumulated depreciation and amortisation. [Refer: Depreciation and amortisation expense]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Accumulated impairment [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Accumulated impairment [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 減損損失累計額 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for accumulated impairment. [Refer: Impairment loss]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of recognised finance lease as assets by lessee [line items]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of recognised finance lease as assets by lessee [line items]
標準ラベル（日）: 借手が資産として認識したファイナンス・リースの開示 [表示項目]
定義: Line items represent concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes of the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Recognised finance lease as assets

定義: The amount of assets recognised by the entity, which are leased under finance leases.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of finance lease and operating lease by lessee [text block]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of finance lease and operating lease by lessee [text block]
標準ラベル（日）: 借手によるファイナンス・リース及びオペレーティング・リースの開示 [テキストブロック]
定義: The disclosure of finance leases and operating leases by the lessee.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of finance lease and operating lease by lessee [abstract]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of finance lease and operating lease by lessee [abstract]
標準ラベル（日）: 借手によるファイナンス・リース及びオペレーティング・リースの開示 [タイトル項目]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of finance lease and operating lease by lessee [table]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of finance lease and operating lease by lessee [table]
標準ラベル（日）: 借手によるファイナンス・リース及びオペレーティング・リースの開示 [表]
定義: Schedule disclosing information related to finance leases and operating leases by the lessee.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Maturity [axis]
標準ラベル（英）: Maturity [axis]
標準ラベル（日）: 満期 [軸]
定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Aggregated time bands [member]
標準ラベル（英）: Aggregated time bands [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 全期間合計 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for aggregated time bands. It also represents the standard value for the 'Maturity' axis if no other member is used.

標準ラベル（英）: Not later than one year [member]

標準ラベル（日）: 5年超 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for a time band of later than five years.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Disclosure of finance lease and operating lease by lessee [line items]
標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of finance lease and operating lease by lessee [line items]
標準ラベル（日）: 借手によるファイナンス・リース及びオペレーティング・リースの開示 [表示項目]
定義: Line items represent concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes of the table.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Minimum finance lease payments payable
標準ラベル（英）: Minimum finance lease payments payable
標準ラベル（日）: 支払最低ファイナンス・リース料総額
定義: The amount of payments over the finance lease term that the lessee is or can be required to make, excluding contingent rent, costs for services and taxes to be paid by, and reimbursed to, the lessor, together with any amounts guaranteed by the lessee or by a party related to the lessee.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Minimum finance lease payments payable, at present value
標準ラベル（英）: Minimum finance lease payments payable, at present value
標準ラベル（日）: 支払最低ファイナンス・リース料総額（現在価値）
定義: The present value of minimum finance lease payments payable. [Refer: Minimum finance lease payments payable]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Future finance charge on finance lease
標準ラベル（英）: Future finance charge on finance lease
標準ラベル（日）: ファイナンス・リースに係る将来の金融費用
定義: The amount representing the difference between the future minimum finance lease payments and their present value. Minimum lease payments are payments over the lease term that the lessee is or can be required to make, excluding contingent rent, costs for services and taxes to be paid by, and reimbursed to, the lessor, together with: (a) for a lessee, any amounts guaranteed by the lessee or by a party related to the lessee; or (b) for a lessor, any residual value guaranteed to the lessor by: (i) the lessee; (ii) a party related to the lessee; or (iii) a third party unrelated to the lessor that is financially capable of discharging the obligations under the guarantee.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Minimum lease payments payable under non-cancellable operating lease
標準ラベル（英）: Minimum lease payments payable under non-cancellable operating lease
標準ラベル（日）: 解約不能オペレーティング・リースによる最低支払リース料総額
定義: The amount of future minimum lease payments payable under non-cancellable operating leases. Minimum lease payments are payments over the lease term that the lessee is or can be required to make, excluding contingent rent, costs for services and taxes to be paid by, and reimbursed to, the lessor, together with: (a) for a lessee, any amounts guaranteed by the lessee or by a party related to the lessee; or (b) for a lessor, any residual value guaranteed to the lessor by: (i) the lessee; (ii) a party related to the lessee; or (iii) a third party unrelated to the lessor that is financially capable of discharging the obligations under the guarantee.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Minimum lease payments of arrangements that include payments for non-lease elements
標準ラベル（英）: Minimum lease payments of arrangements that include payments for non-lease elements
標準ラベル（日）: 非リース要素に対する支払を含んだ契約の最低リース料総額
定義: Minimum lease payments related to arrangements that include payments for non-lease elements. Minimum lease payments are payments over the lease term that the lessee is or can be required to make, excluding contingent rent, costs for services and taxes to be paid by and reimbursed to the lessor, together with: (a) for a lessee, any amounts guaranteed by the lessee or by a party related to the lessee; or (b) for a lessor, any residual value guaranteed to the lessor by: (i) the lessee; (ii) a party related to the lessee; or (iii) a third party unrelated to the lessor that is financially capable of discharging the obligations under the guarantee.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Minimum lease payments of other arrangements that do not include payments for non-lease elements
標準ラベル（英）: Minimum lease payments of other arrangements that do not include payments for non-lease elements
標準ラベル（日）: 非リース要素に対する支払を含まない他の契約の最低リース料総額
定義: Minimum lease payments related to arrangements that do not include payments for non-lease elements. Minimum lease payments are payments over the lease term that the lessee is or can be required to make, excluding contingent rent, costs for services and taxes to be paid by, and reimbursed to, the lessor, together with: (a) for a lessee, any amounts guaranteed by the lessee or by a party related to the lessee; or (b) for a lessor, any residual value guaranteed to the lessor by: (i) the lessee; (ii) a party related to the lessee; or (iii) a third party unrelated to the lessor that is financially capable of discharging the obligations under the guarantee.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Lease and sublease payments recognised as expense [abstract]
標準ラベル（英）: Lease and sublease payments recognised as expense [abstract]
標準ラベル（日）: 費用として認識したリース料及びサブリース料 [タイトル項目]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Contingent rents recognised as expense, classified as finance lease
標準ラベル（英）: Contingent rents recognised as expense, classified as finance lease
標準ラベル（日）: 費用として認識した変動リース料（ファイナンス・リースに分類）
定義: The amount of contingent rents recognised as an expense for finance leases. [Refer: Contingent rents recognised as expense]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Contingent rents recognised as expense, classified as operating lease
標準ラベル（英）: Contingent rents recognised as expense, classified as operating lease
標準ラベル（日）: 費用として認識した変動リース料（オペレーティング・リースに分類）
定義: The amount of contingent rents recognised as an expense for operating leases. [Refer: Contingent rents recognised as expense]

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Total contingent rents recognised as expense
標準ラベル（英）: Contingent rents recognised as expense
標準ラベル（日）: 費用として認識した変動リース料
定義: The portion of lease payments recognised as an expense that is not fixed in amount but is based on the future amount of a factor that changes other than with the passage of time (for example, percentage of future sales, amount of future use, future price indices, future market rates of interest).

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Sublease payments recognised as expense
標準ラベル（英）: Sublease payments recognised as expense
標準ラベル（日）: 費用として認識したサブリース料
定義: The amount of payments made for subleases recognised as an expense.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Minimum operating lease payments recognised as expense
標準ラベル（英）: Minimum operating lease payments recognised as expense
標準ラベル（日）: 費用として認識した最低オペレーティング・リース料
定義: The portion of operating lease payments that the lessee is or can be required to make, excluding contingent rent, costs for services and taxes to be paid by, and reimbursed to, the lessor, together with any amounts guaranteed by the lessee or by a party related to the lessee recognised as an expense.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Total lease and sublease payments recognised as expense
標準ラベル（英）: Lease and sublease payments recognised as expense
標準ラベル（日）: 費用として認識したリース料及びサブリース料
定義: The amount of payments on leases and subleases recognised as an expense by the lessee.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Expected future minimum sublease payments receivable under non-cancellable subleases, classified as finance lease
標準ラベル（英）: Expected future minimum sublease payments receivable under non-cancellable subleases, classified as finance lease
標準ラベル（日）: 解約不能サブリースによる将来の予想最低受取サブリース料：ファイナンス・リースに分類
定義: The amount of future minimum sublease payments expected to be received under non-cancellable subleases for finance leases. Minimum lease payments are payments over the lease term that the lessee is, or can be, required to make, excluding contingent rent, costs for services and taxes to be paid by, and reimbursed to, the lessor, together with: (a) for a lessee, any amounts guaranteed by the lessee or by a party related to the lessee; or (b) for a lessor, any residual value guaranteed to the lessor by: (i) the lessee; (ii) a party related to the lessee; or (iii) a third party unrelated to the lessor that is financially capable of discharging the obligations under the guarantee.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Expected future minimum sublease payments receivable under non-cancellable subleases, classified as operating lease
標準ラベル（英）: Expected future minimum sublease payments receivable under non-cancellable subleases, classified as operating lease
標準ラベル（日）: 解約不能サブリースによる将来の予想最低受取サブリース料：オペレーティング・リースに分類
定義: The amount of future minimum sublease payments expected to be received under non-cancellable subleases for operating leases. Minimum lease payments are payments over the lease term that the lessee is, or can be, required to make, excluding contingent rent, costs for services and taxes to be paid by, and reimbursed to, the lessor, together with: (a) for a lessee, any amounts guaranteed by the lessee or by a party related to the lessee; or (b) for a lessor, any residual value guaranteed to the lessor by: (i) the lessee; (ii) a party related to the lessee; or (iii) a third party unrelated to the lessor that is financially capable of discharging the obligations under the guarantee.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of material leasing arrangements by lessee classified as finance lease
標準ラベル（英）: Description of material leasing arrangements by lessee classified as finance lease
標準ラベル（日）: ファイナンス・リースに分類された借手の重要性があるリース契約の記述
定義: The general description of the lessee's material leasing arrangements for finance leases including, but not limited to: (a) the basis on which contingent rent payable is determined; (b) the existence and terms of renewal or purchase options and escalation clauses; and (c) restrictions imposed by lease arrangements, such as those concerning dividends, additional debt and further leasing.

表示リンク（優先ラベル）: Description of material leasing arrangements by lessee classified as operating lease
標準ラベル（英）: Description of material leasing arrangements by lessee classified as operating lease
標準ラベル（日）: オペレーティング・リースに分類された借手の重要性があるなリース契約の記述
定義: The general description of the lessee's significant leasing arrangements for operating leases including, but not limited to: (a) the basis on which contingent rent payable is determined; (b) the existence and terms of renewal or purchase options and escalation clauses; and (c) restrictions imposed by lease arrangements, such as those concerning dividends, additional debt and further leasing.

定義: The disclosure of finance leases and operating leases by the lessor.

標準ラベル（英）: Disclosure of finance lease and operating lease by lessor [abstract]

標準ラベル（日）: 満期 [軸]
定義: The axis of a table defines the relationship between the domain members or categories in the table and the line items or concepts that complete the table.

標準ラベル（英）: Aggregated time bands [member]
標準ラベル（日）: 全期間合計 [メンバー]
定義: This member stands for aggregated time bands. It also represents the standard value for the 'Maturity' axis if no other member is used.

標準ラベル（英）: Not later than one year [member]

定義: This member stands for a time band of not later than one year.

定義: This member stands for a time band of later than one year and not later than five years.
